text: Always tastes like homecooked

name: Angela Madrigal
text: The food was very  cold upon delivery to table. I sent back and  new hot meal returned. Syrup in bottle was cold. I had to ask for it to be heated up. Server very friendly and apologized.

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, Angela. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please make the subject line your review username, and include in the body of the email: your phone number and email address, location you visited, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better.

name: Patrick Grenier
text: I'm planning on coming to Cracker Barrel Old Country Store on Thursday for Thanksgiving Dinner.  I was making sure that they were going to be Open and their Hours.

name: Ross Darnell
text: My one-year-old grandson's favorite place. Do just about eat a whole order of hash brown casserole and a entire fried egg

name: Thomas Cherry
text: Absolutely horrid experience. Ordered to go at 06:51pm didn’t get my order until 07:52pm. Embarrassing waiting on my food in the way of the gift shop shoppers. Steer as far away from this place as you can. We have plenty of alternatives who actually care about their customers. Staff seemed relieved that I didn’t elevate the issue and just wanted me out of their hair.

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, Thomas. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please include your phone number and email address, location you visited, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better. Thank you.

name: James borden
text: Live love love their tater tots lol. Please convert the Cracker Barrel north of Fort Worth to these and get rid of the old style tater tots.

name: Catherine Vaughn
text: Got our table in a timely manner and everyone was 6ft apart. And our waiter was wonderful!

name: Eric Dumas
text: Its was ok my food was cold but the wait staff is amazing

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, Eric. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please include: phone number, email address, store location, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better.

name: Chastity Huffman
text: The service was ok and some of the food was good some of it was ok. Service needs a little help.

name: Adrienne Mitry
text: Very nice store. I enjoyed walking around and found a super cute hat.

name: Carey Wood
text:
We ordered. Waitess came back and said they were out of what our son had ordered. He ordered something else. 45 mins later still no food and empty glasses for the past 30 mins. Everyone in our section was getting uneasy and frustrated. It wasn't just taking us a long time to get out food. Everyone had problems. Only one table got food in the 50 minutes we were there. They were not that busy either.
Waitress finally came back to our table and started they were out of chicken pot pie and asked what else did our son's friend want. 45 minutes after we ordered she let us know they were out of something else! My husband asked to speak to a manager. He quickly blamed it on the waitess and said everyone was told what they were out of. He did not try to fix the problem just blamed the waitress. He never even apologized. We got up and left and went to Texas Roadhouse.
Management at the Cracker Barrel in Florence, AL stinks! Big guy, red hair and bushy beard does not need to be in management, if he can't even say he's sorry.

resp.text: We're truly sorry to hear about your visit, Carey. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please include your phone number and email address, location you visited, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better. Thank you.

name: William Gray
text: Went to this cracker Barrel cause was just passing by and after I ate there I really wish I had kept going.  Ordered House Salad and fish dinner . The very nice young lady brought salad out after me seeing there a long while and said they had just put it up for her.  She then turned a went and got food and brought out.  There was no time to eat salad or even get a good start at it.   Then my fish sat there and got cold and after adding tarter sauce it was really cold.  Of all the time I sat there waiting on the food I could have really enjoyed that salad.

name: Roberta Bryan
text: Myself and grandbaby went. Food was ok. I left gratuity, however I felt like we were being rushed. Hadn't even taken a bite of food and was given check. Not one of my best experiences at a Crackle Barrel. Been to many, but, This visit was not as pleasant!! Bought cups and got home only to find one of them chipped.  This particular visit... kinda made me want to, not go to Crackle Barrel again. But in my heart I know other locations that were more family like. More pleasant....

resp.text: We're truly sorry to hear about your visit, Roberta. Can you please email us some additional information at SocialMediaAdmin@crackerbarrel.com? Please include: your phone number and email address, location you visited, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better. We'd love the chance to make it right.

name: w S
text: ordered momma's pancake breakfast and the pan cakes tasted like they were cooked in burnt grease, eggs were cold and sausage was pink in the middle. will never visit CB again. And they were slow!

name: Randy Yarbrough
text: The food and service is awesome

name: Susie Carroll
text: The Best place too eat you can get breakfast all day the food is so so DELICIOUS AND THE STAFF IS WONDERFUL AND I REALLY ENJOY MINI SHOPPING MY FAVORITE IS THE JEWELRY THEY HAVE A WONDERFUL AND GREAT 😊😊😊 SECTION GO AND ENJOY YOURSELF GOD BLESS. Ms. S. Carroll

name: Jenn Adams
text: Extra seating outside to accommodate more guests.  Fast service and always yummy food!

name: Jason Danley
text: Reason for the 3 star and not a 2 star is only because of the service. Cracker Barrel used to be a great place with really good food. It's been the same place for as long as I can remember. No updates, and no food updates. I got shrimp, hashbrown casserole, turnips, and okra. The shrimp could have been thrown through a window (hard), the casserole had way too much onion in it, and the turnips tasted like old grease. The okra was good, and the tea was good. That's about it. Maybe I should have gotten breakfast..

name: Chloe Bergsing
text: It’s a great restaurant, and the all-day breakfast pancakes are the best!! 🍽🥞

name: Harley White
text: Been doordashing for months. I no how pick up works when you walk in. I had not just one cashier but two of them be rude. After the fact looking for something for my girlfriend and the second cashier yelled at me that i need to stay in the pick up line. I was looking to buy something as I was waiting on someone's pick up order they call the names as they come out so why can I not look for a gift. I know I want pick up no doordash orders from them again or personal.

name: Carolyn Mccullough
text: Great place to eat!

name: Hillary Domingue
text: Cracker Barrell is an awesome place to eat. They have very friendly waitstaff and the food and store is amazing

name: Chrystal Domskie
text: Got in immediately, great service and the food was great!

name: Leticia Norman (Faithfullyposhed)
text: Great food great service

name: Jorge Garcia
text: Very nice, good location, great service, will go again

name: Pamela Liner
text: Good food, great atmosphere

name: Joey Liles Jr
text: We seem to always get the new hire but can't beat the soul food

name: Bennie Moncrease
text:
The service is professional, kind and friendly.

Great selections of food items.

Cost is affordable.

name: xMysticGaming
text: The food is usually good, but the service up front is lacking.

name: Richard Byrd
text: We arrived at the location in Florence Alabama before a shopping day.  Service and food were great! However during the state mandate of face covering requirements it was not there! Shopped at Kohls, shoe carnival,  and Sams club! All required face mask before entering! None which serve food! Even had a argument with others that were in my bubble of 6ft and not wearing mask!! Mask were provided at front door!! Management took no action!! I guess not required at the Florence location!! No respect for my health or others!!

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, Richard. Can you please email us some additional information at SocialMediaAdmin@crackerbarrel.com? Please include: your phone number and email address, location you visited, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better.

name: The Lost Navigators
text: Loved this place , enjoyed the food here , loved the biscuits , loved the vintage value !

name: Dennis Woods
text: Great comfort food and friendly staff.

name: VIOLET JANE
text: Great food friendly staff

name: Morning Star
text: Everything was great as always

name: Jerry Gentrup
text: Good food and great service

name: Elizabeth Wade
text: The food is amazing and theres hardly a wait for a table. And if you do have to wait you can shop in their store for cool items.

name: Mary McDaniel
text: We were seated quickly, but waited 15 minutes before a waitress came and got our drink order. When the waitress finally came there was no apology, but she did a good job after that.

name: Chelsea Cureton
text: I love cracker barrel. 💓

name: Selena Peach
text: Breakfast is amazing; four stars, because the lunch isn't as good. Fast service and great employees. Nice and decent sized shop as well. Prices in the shop are a bit high, however, food prices are good.

name: James Foster
text: Great Food Everytime

name: Jane Permenter
text: Great food and service.

name: Tony Sandrell
text: Country Boy Breakfast Best Steak and Eggs in town.. Great service and A+ to the cook..

name: Mandy Yager
text: Was very good

name: Maria Espitia
text: I like to eat their sometime when I am out and about

name: Tracy Tyer
text: The person that answered the phone was rude when I got there to pick up my food they didn't even have a order for me. Had to wait for them to figure out where my order was, when I made it home and looked at the order it was wrong

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear about your experience, Tracy. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please include your phone number and email address, the location you visited, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better.

name: nathan littleton
text: Food was Good as usual and the service was satisfactory as usual. I go there alot

name: Evelyn Servin
text: It's a good restaurant to eat. I gave 4 stars because its always cold and there's a long wait time. However, the service was great, the food was hot, good portions. I don't like their gravy at all-- it's too thick and flourery. Their biscuits and corn bread are  pretty good on the other hand. I totally love their hashbrown casserole (just wish it was a bigger portion. ) my kid always orders the pork chop big country boy breakfast and I always get the pecan pancakes with my main meal.

name: Linda Crews
text: Wonderful place to eat. We try to stop in anytime we get close

name: Red Heis
text: Not the same as before the shutdown, not all food is served hot !!! Serving sizes are also SMALLER !

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, Red. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please include: phone number, email address, store location, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better.

name: Sandra Smithson
text: Love cracker barrell

name: Julie Pitts
text: It's Cracker Barrel! But they did have very friendly staff and it is clean. The food was served fast and was delicious.

name: Brenda Reed
text: I was a little disappointed in the limited menu but we had a wonderful server and great service.

name: Tina C
text: Love the food always good.

name: Anna Lee
text: Homestyle southern cooking. Wonderful staff, usually. There is a small shop in the waiting area. Outside, you can sit in rocking chairs and/or play checkers. For how busy the restaurant is, waiting to be seated is never a pain. The restrooms are clean, and I have never seen one out of order.

name: June Suggs
text: It was real nice

name: francis faciane
text: Food is ok, have problems substituting sides. Not worth the hassle

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, Francis. Can you please email us some additional information at SocialMediaAdmin@crackerbarrel.com? Please include: your phone number and email address, location you visited, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better.

name: FBF Family
text: Great customer service! Just went in to shop clearance and staff was helpful in my search for a particular item. Always clean and food is consistently good.

name: Fredia Lovelace
text: Curtious service and great food

name: Whitney Shelnutt
text: Took 20 minutes for drinks, 45 for food,  was told they had a bread shortage, that we couldn't get biscuits.. Waitress came once to check on us and wasn't to friendly.. I'd give half a star but the tea was good.. Cullman is much better.

name: Carol Warren
text: Food was good and employees were very nice

name: George Hoffmann
text: Always great food, always meeting friends there.

name: Donna Garrison
text: Great stick to your ribs food and great service.

name: Tiffany Nichols
text: They cook over-medium eggs perfectly. The restaurant is clean, the food is good and the store is fun to browse. It would be nice if the store was a little bigger, but what can you do. Service is ok.

name: Tyler Martin
text: They have outside seating now because of COVID-19. It's wonderful!!

name: Drew Mauck
text: Another Cracker Barrel in a Lowe’s parking lot. Not very cozy or country. I get it that Cracker Barrel likes its restaurants to be in a busy area but this has no rv park, no grassy area and no charm at all. It’s just a big parking lot with a restaurant in the middle. It’s not inviting in any way to me. I’ll give this location a miss and hit the next one down the road

name: Daniel Godwin
text: I am a life long fan. I am hoping the full menu will be back.

name: David Willis
text: The food that we recieved was good. But my problem is with the food we didn't get. We ordered breakfast. It wasn't even that late, maybe 8oclock by the time we were fully finished and leaving. They never brought the biscuits, which we paid for because they were part of the breakfast meals we bought. We kept asking the waitress for them. And she kept saying they are still making them. So we finished our entire meal, when I went to pay to said something and they said we are so sorry. Would you like to take the biscuits with you. Well no I wouldn't, 1st of all were done eating. And 2nd if they are ready for me to take with me why weren't they ready to eat with my meal. They didn't offer to take any off the check bc I paid for something I didn't get. Nothing. Just offered the biscuits I'd been asking for my whole stay but couldn't get. Really disappointing considering i went there especially for breakfast food. We were there for about an hour in total. You can make biscuits from scratch in that long.

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, David. Can you please email us some additional information at SocialMediaAdmin@crackerbarrel.com? Please include: phone number, email address, store location, as well as any other relevant information that could help us understand the situation better.

name: Dave In Alabama
text: Nice to pickup orders that were done online

name: John Whitlock
text: Had Mama's pancake breakfast.  As always it was delicious. Never gotten a bad meal here.

name: Dianne Mitchell
text: The food is good. If you are dining in the customer service is great.  Ordering takeout is a nightmare though.  Even after you call your order in you still have to wait a long time before it's ready when you arrive at the restaurant to pick it up.  Sometimes I have waited 30 minutes or more to bring my food I ordered over the phone and the place was not busy.

name: lawrence Hart
text: The chain itself just isnt as good as it used to be.

name: Kristi Spears
text: Love this place

name: ML Howell
text: Sometimes there is no love in the food. It's not as good as it used to be.

name: Robin Featherston
text: I had the turkey dinner special, it was SO good. My waitress was really nice.

name: Chris Melton
text: Great food good time with our family. It's a real treat to get to spend this time with our grandparents. Life is short an time is a theif an a place like this is the best place to make these memories. So thank you Cracker barrel.

name: Charles Swindle
text: Got chicken livers great. Hot cornbread on  cold day hot the spot

name: Chuck Missildine
text: Food was terrible. Tested as if the largest portion of my meal came from a tin can. There was NOTHING fresh. Service was decent but the restaurant was a bit unkempt.  The floors were in desperate need of a good cleaning.  The bathroom was in deplorable condition. Paper everywhere,  garbage cans in need of attention and the smell..ugh! The cost was over priced for what turned out to be a disappointment in dining. The lot and grounds were less than inviting and in need of attention. I will not be returning and would never recommend this establishment to friends unless I wanted to punish them.

name: Stephanie G
text: Ordered to go online. Waited 15 minutes for order that should have been waiting for me. Food is always good but I ordered early so it would be ready. Would have canceled order but they take your money before I knew it wasn't ready. They won't get me again!

name: Robert Smith
text: Half of food was cold

name: David Knuckle
text: Ignored at the reception desk. She walked past and said be right with you.  Started to adjust displays right in front of us! I guess we didn't look like her type of people. So rude. We walked out. Won't go back

name: Patsy Logan
text: It was okay because of the food although my chicken was a little over cooked, not juicy inside as usual. Cracker Barrel can't hardly be outdone, but today wasn't the best. The service was a server that hasn't been trained or does not listen. He would stand on one side of the table and hand the food/drinks to me across the front of  people sitting beside me. NOT COOL.  The cashier ask if everything was ok and I told her except for the waiter. She didn't ask why or anything...

name: Jonathon Crosby
text: Good country food good service

name: Debra Lyn Denison
text: Delicious food no matter what you order! The Mac and cheese is the best in world according to my daughter

name: Beverly Peters
text: Wonderful meal and service!

name: Melissa Thorn
text: Great food. Great service.  Good prices

name: Jennifer Silcox
text: Loren was the sweetest server. She was very polite and attentive. Our family always enjoys Cracker Barrel's food and now Loren has set the bar for service! Thank you!

name: Jeff Burnett
text: Very good service and food

name: Subastjion Ritter
text: Took my two little ones there for Valentine's Day breakfast / dinner. The food was excellent and even though they were busy, the wait wasn't too bad. The waitress was extremely nice, and she said she was new. However, everything was perfect.

name: Marie Flannagin
text: I love Cracker Barrel.

name: Pedro Garcia
text: Good service good food

name: Kitty Cat
text: Staff is amazing. And they have excellent food. And a fantastic gift shop.

name: Susan Hamm
text: Cracker Barrel is a pleasant lovely place to enjoy your meal. The service and food was excellent. Our waitress was a very caring sweet lady and we had a terrific time. Well worth visiting again. Again the food was so so delicious.

name: Guy Holmes
text: Good service. Ordered the egg sandwich which was very good. Love their sweet tea.

name: Barb Kirtman
text: Tried several locations, just not a fan. Coffee is fresh, but weak and tasteless. Eggs good, but sausage patty dry and tough to chew. Won't be trying again.

name: Boyce Q “Austin T” Kennedy III
text: The staff at this Cracker Barrel is extraordinarily nice, friendly, and quick to return with your food. I always enjoyed going there when I’m visiting my dad.

name: Charles Gray
text: Service was slow tonight. Had to ask different waitress for a refill of tea. Food was great as always. We have visited thos Cracker Barrel several times and we have never had bad service until tonight. This low rating has nothing to do with the restaurant. It is clean, friendly staff and great food as always, serves breakfast all day too. Waitress gets 3 stars and that's being gracious. Restaurant gets 5 stars.

name: Michael Gross
text:
If you don't mind incompetence in a establishment this is the place for you.  Sorry but all wow is all i can say about this cracker barrel experience.  It started with the hostess, we checked in and was told about a 30 min wait because we had a party of 6.  When i checked back with them 30 mins later i saw our name had a table number 157 attached to our name and was told by the hostess that they were waiting on another table and it would another 10 mins.  After that 10 mins was up, i checked back in with the hostess and noticed the number changed to 214 and the hostess mentioned another 10 mins as they are still waiting for a table to open up.  In the mean time, 10 sets of 2 and 2 sets of 3 were seated while my party waited for this mysterious table to open up.

Secondly, if you have three cash registers open and only one seems to be working on cashing out customers, something is wrong.  I have family now living in Florence but will wait a long time before attempting to eat at this establishment again.

name: Larry Melton
text: The food and service was excellent, but, when paying the cashier said tap green button once for tip, tap green button 2 times for no tip. The tip was left on table, and the recipe folded nicely in half with tip added in. The trans. Was redone. Just check recipt.

name: Marla Baker
text: Bad service

resp.text: Sorry to hear about the poor experience, Marla. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please use your review username as your subject line, and include: phone number, email address, store location, as well as any additional information you’d like to share with us.

name: snew
text: One of my favorite cracker barrels!  Everyone is great and food is always good! Feels like family when there, so many of the crew knows us by name. I take my mother every weekend when I'm up from Cullman.

name: Sandra Eddins
text: There was a huge line when we got there, but we were seated immediately.  Our server was perfect. No empty glasses, which we usually keep them busy with refills. Food was great. I always get the cracker barrel sampler at dinnertime.

name: dena king
text: The food was cooked perfectly our waittres was very nice and fast

name: Mark Parker
text: Great food. Service was a mite slow for the low number of customers. The banana pudding is awesome.

name: cory buffaloe
text: I love Cracker Barrel. You can't go wrong with this place. From pancakes to the dinners, everything is good.

name: Jeremy Wise
text: Service was good. Was out of chicken fried steak. I was disappointed

name: Alabama Gemstones
text: Hot, fresh breakfast

name: curious creations
text: Awesome service!  Food was very good!  Thank you for a good experience!

name: Dawn Buttrum
text: All was good except the sausage patties were not cooked inside.

name: Perry Mcarthur
text: Menu needs improvement and somebody needs to teach the cooks how to properly make a BLT . last time i got BLT they buttered N grilled the bread ao much the butter literally was dripping off the bread. Could not even eat after the first bite.

name: Devon Henley
text: Speedy service even with a packed house

name: Harry D Smith
text: I love the oatmeal breakfast.  Top it off with a bottomless cup of coffee and you have a great meal.

name: TheDetroDiesel
text: Country fixins cooked to perfection and a down home staff and atmosphere

name: Nina Coats
text: Food was great

name: Gene Gresham
text: Cracker barrel is a good family restaurant where you can get together with family and friends. They have good home cooked food and a friendly atmosphere. Check it out if you haven't already.

name: Amy McArthur
text: The store was just as I remembered. The food was delivered, fast, hot, and delicious. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.

name: Tony Allen
text: Love there and they are very friendly.

name: Taryn Doxie
text: Very, very good food and service. Didn’t have to wait long either !!

name: Charles Swindle
text: Went there tonight Will was our server and never missed a beat. He was great. The catfish was fried very well cooked. Cornbread was very good. We will be back and hopefully get Will again.

name: oompa “oompf” looompa
text: Great, cozy and welcoming place. Fast service and amazing hospitality.

name: Dean Jackson
text: Picked up two meals and while we really like CB my serving of carrots netted six pieces while my wife's order had 12 or so.  They also didn't put our bread in the bag; not good.  But the food was great.

name: Mary Hughes
text: Very disappointed this time food was cold & bland cornmuffins were so hard had to ask for fresher ones grilled pork chop was tuff & had no flavor at all , dressing had a lil to much sage, overall not a good dinner

name: Beverly Emerson
text: Had to wait over an hour

name: Brittany Wood (bwooderp)
text: Service was fast considering how packed the parking lot was. However, the food was less than satisfactory. I ordered the French toast with strawberries; the French toast seemed to be only toasted bread and the bottled syrup was the only source of flavor. The strawberries were not fresh but were frozen, however I saw at another table that someone received pancakes with strawberries that were clearly fresh. My grandmother ordered gravy and was dissatisfied with its taste. We have decided we will most likely never eat at Cracker Barrel again as the food is just not the same quality anymore.

name: Lisa Wood
text: Great place and the most helpful people! I ordered a meal for my family and it was awesome!My grandma who is now 90 and not able to cook anymore loved it. The whole family did. I will definately do this again.

name: Cindy Prince
text: The food wasn't very good. Also it was served almost cold.We were expecting so much more but just didn't deliver .I don't know what all the hype is about.

name: Nathaniel Whitaker
text: Very busy but our waitress was wonderful. She took great care of us and was so kind. She even brought my six year old daughter a free hot chocolate that just made her night!

name: Katie Hardy
text: Best customer service ever! All of the servers are very attentive and polite. The food is amazing. I always get breakfast. Their coffees are amazing and if they still have the beignets try them! They are perfect!

name: Craig Casiday
text:
The host somehow lost us off of the wait list.  After 45 minutes of waiting they had seated everyone but us.
When the second host offered to take out name and we told her that we should have been on the list already because we had been waiting for 45 minutes she said, "you should have...".
When we spoke with the manager she told us "some parties of two didn't show when they were called."

Dinner was good, our service was good, and they did give us free dessert.    My real problem with this experience is that they tried to share the blame with us for their mistake.

name: Rachel Purser
text: Our waitress was probably the best one we have ever had in a long time. Very friendly, fast and helpful! Needless to say she got a great tip. Love the New menu to! Good job Florence Cracker Barrel!

name: Dre Taylor
text: Did a pick up order. Foods was great !

name: Savage Ali Zugel (李野蛮)
text:
You know there is a large senior citizen population when you find a Cracker Barrel THIS far from an interstate. God bless them. Cracker Barrel is delicious.

We went in on memorial day evening. Joshua was our server and was excellent. He was the nicest, sincere, and attentive server I've had at any eatery since moving to Alabama last spring. Thanks again, Sir!

A warning if you aren't familiar with CB or southern food: when ordering the vegetarian dinner, be sure to specify that you dont want any bacon in each item in which you're ordering. Seriously...

name: Margie Wright
text: I think I could stay all day looking around.they have the prettiest things. If I did stay I could have all three meals of the day and I mean good meal.

name: chay welsh
text: My daughter and I were in a hurry. So we decided to just get takeout so I went inside it took about 15 minutes to get a waitress just the ticket take out order and I said to her I have to run and go get something next door she said it will just be one minute I said should I wait or can I go she said no go it'll be ready when you get back I was gone for about 15 minutes expecting them to be ready when I got back and she hadn't even put the order in. I will never get take out there again they did compensate my order which I do appreciate but I will not go back again.

name: Davis Custom -Lyndsey Davis
text: The store selection is great and the food is even better. We never mind a wait to eat here and the coffee and mocha drinks are amazing.

name: Jennie Linn Medders (Lucy)
text: Cracker Barrel is always great and the food is always served piping hot  !!! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

name: Jim Byrum
text: Always great food n friendly service n a clean resttuant

name: kalyn montague
text: Great food and the company was even better. Excellent service and the price was reasonable.

name: KAY FOWLER
text: Food was good service was good too and they have a nice gift shop.

name: River Lafloor
text: All around goods place to eat

name: Jason Azbell
text: Food and service was great.

name: Vickie Clemmons
text: Shari was a great server! Very good Friday fish meal.

name: Jamie Statom
text: Get the strawberry lemonade. No, seriously, get it. My waitress brought two glasses to start because she knew I would drink both. And I did. And a third. ~ Seriously~, get the strawberry lemonade.

name: John Acker
text: Food is always good plus great service

name: Megan Hollander
text: I alwyas have a great experience here. Their food is amazing and always hot. They keep my coffee cup full and make sure I have enough cream :)

name: Patty Beavers
text: Great food & service

name: Carol Tate
text: Love eating here. Great food

name: Chase McClure
text: Friendly customer service

name: RW W
text: They need to bring back the chicken fried chicken ! Otherwise everything is good.

name: Ro bn Barb
text: Very good and not high

name: Daniel Surber
text: Great food and service

name: Cecil Staggs
text: Food was cooked perfect! Our waitress was amazing we never had to ask for anything!  Great experience! Definitely will return

name: Lewis Masterson
text: Was great food and service. The only problem I had is at the busy time you don't have room in the store because it is crowded. I am in a wheelchair an that made it so much harder on me you either need to add on or take some supplies out.

name: Jesyka Davis (Jess)
text: Our server and hostess was friendly. Great food for a good price.

name: Ben Pennington
text: It's hard to beat a Cracker Barrel and this one was no exception.  Everything we had for breakfast was good and hot as you would expect.  I do miss their red eye gravy which was discontinued by the corporate office.  Big mistake IMHO.

name: Kurt Hanke
text:
The food and the service were both good.

Also, it's always fun browsing through their store before sitting down for dinner.

name: Virginia Lamy
text: Food good. Servers very polite. They take care of their customers.

name: Jessica Riley
text: I was one of 2 people picking up a togo order and the parking spaces set for us were already taken so obviously the signs don't work. I got there 20 minutes after my estimated pickup time and still had to wait 10 more minutes for them to bring it out. They left out my okra and when she went to get it I was told it would be a 3 minute wait for it to cook. I asked the cashier who rang me up to add some extra biscuits, maple syrup, and honey mustard because when you order online they don't give you the option to ask for these things. I heard her tell someone through the headset she was wearing. They left off my honey mustard and also didn't give me any plastic ware or the extra napkins I had added to my online order. They were kind of busy but like i said i waited 20 minutes after the time they told me to be there and still had to wait longer and not get everything i asked for. It's just annoying to be honest.

name: Janet Boatright
text: Great place to eat and good place to work . Have meet  a lot of great people working there.

name: A W
text: Love the chicken and dumplings, but my local CB gives bigger helpings.

name: Lydia Drueke Gipson
text: It is surprising how many places to not know how to cook fried eggs over medium. I have never had a problem at this Cracker Barrel. The dinning room and clean and the music is not to loud. We have always gotten good service.

name: Kathryn Schram Findlay
text: Wooden chairs are very uncomfortable... Need cushions. Floors sticky, sticky stuff on bottoms of my shoes. Our server Kristan was very good‼️Had breakfast, very good! ☕🍳🥘🥞

name: Mary Ivy
text: One of our favorite Places To eat

name: Latricia Hensley
text: Love to shop while waiting. Food was good and staff was friendly. The wait was long but it went fast while looking around.

name: Darlene McDonald
text: Great food & selections. Very friendly staff. Great place to shop also in the country store.

name: MiFamilia Wolfe
text: It was our very first time and we can now see why it's so popular! Food was great and seemed freshly prepared. Not expensive, very fairly priced. I highly suggest the beneighs.

name: Jackie Hughes
text: Love cracker barrel. Always a fun time especially with kiddos in the store.

name: lisag williams
text: Hashbrown casserole is all you really need to know....and get the burger.

name: Steve Tidwell
text: Country Boy Breakfast, side of 3 pancakes, with milk, coffee, orange juice,  cold ice water!

name: Teresa Stitzel
text: Real friendly, good food, big portions

name: Sheila Roberson
text: It is a very clean family orientated restaurant.The Food was delicious and the service was great.

name: Edith Marie Gray
text: Just yum!

name: Susan Jones
text: Fantastic!

name: Tony Trousdale
text: Worst experience I ever had at a restaurant. People seated in front of us ordered and finished eating and we were still waiting.  The hostess got us water and coffee and kept checking on us.  Our waiter was the worst.  We finally after 30 minutes of waiting got up and left and ate at Bojangles across the road

name: Julia Welborn
text: Food was very tasty, but way to cold. I had to send it back. It wasn't room temperature.  This has happened before.  I really do like cracker barrel. But I need my food hot.

name: Rodney Cotten
text: Good food

name: Erika Byers
text: Absolutely amazing service! Everyone was extremely friendly! Food was wonderful as well.

name: Patti Smith
text: The food was good southern food and had a general store and very good service.

name: Cliff Richey
text: It is always great food and family atmosphere, always see good friends that I haven't seen in a while.

name: Get Brad
text: Excellent place to have breakfast, lunch or even dinner. Great family atmosphere, and great tasting food served in a timely manner.

name: Philip Posey
text: We had a great meal and wonderful service! They are always busy at this location but take time to treat you like family.

name: Sam Murphy
text: This place is brand new and is not settled in yet. It's always crowded and I have a tough time dealing with it in my opinion. I ordered a simple meal eggs bacon and toast took them over half an hour to get it out to me. I was ready to leave. They will do better after they've been open for a while

name: Shoals Yakkin' with Hatch
text: Always good for a home cooked style meal. Unusually there was no wait at all. They always make it worth the wait when there is one though.

name: Aaron Alexander
text: Great food.  Great atmosphere!! Wonderful place.

name: Jarl Balgruuf
text: Cracker Barrel is awesome.  You can get flipping pancakes any time you want, I mean that's about enough for 5 stars in itself.  Great food at good prices mean it's hard to go wrong here.  The staff is sometimes a bit distracted/inattentive but as long as you're not willing to flag them down and ask for refills/jelly/whatever you need it's not a big deal.  They're generally friendly and keep the place clean.  It's fairly quiet most of the time (at least for dinner) so it's a good place to chat with family or friends while you eat.  That old country feel and the accompanying country-style menu give this place a unique rustic feel that not many other restaurants offer.

name: Paul Terry
text: The waitress we had can't Remember her name? She a great waitress.

name: Dennis Phillips
text: Not sure if they have changed their sausage but it seemed thinner and tougher than it used to. I asked, but the associate didn't know. The eggs were room temperature, if that. The loaded hashbrown casserole was good though

name: Josh Shouse
text: Great restaurant.  Good down home cooking.  Very friendly and fairly priced.

name: LeChe
text: Food was great as always!! Our waitress was Amazing!!

name: Bradley Mifflin
text: Great home country style like every Cracker Barrel. They have figured this market out and have it cornered. The food is about what you would expect. Nothing fancy, but satisfying.

name: Stephen W.
text: Food and Service were excellent.

name: Angel Cantie
text: Always a good meal!  No worries about feeling ulky after a meal at Cracker Barrell.

name: Sandy Jensen
text: Fast service, fried chicken special was good at a busy time

name: Patsy Smith
text: Good

name: Michael Sturdevant
text: Great people. Great food.

name: Patricia Hill
text: Fresh food and great service

name: Victoria Vanvoltenburg
text: Everyone was very nice and the food was amazing. I love it so much and so does my whole family

name: Lucinda Frost
text:
Today's meal wasn't great. I placed my ordered (4 plates) waited then after a little while, waitress came out and said I'm sorry they are out of cornbread dressing. The only reason I came today on Monday was for the dressing for my son. Lady said everything else was done.
Then when we got home to eat later on, the mashed potatoes were hard. My son wasn't happy with dumplings from here.
It will be awhile before we go back

name: Varuniqa Hernandez
text: Boy friend took me here for breakfast and OMG I LOVE IT

name: Gail Lessard
text: Food and service were great!

name: Demetrius “Jim” Boucher
text: Great food. Wonderful service & love the merchandise.

name: Rocky Phillips
text: I've been eating here my whole life and I've never had a bad experience. Great home style cooking for a reasonable price which brings the only drawback of being BUSY ALL THE TIME. I dont think I've ever been here and not had to wait but it has always been worth the wait

name: Donna Cooper
text: Love cracker barrel. Great food and service.

name: Charlene Moultrie
text: Great food and customer service.   Hamilton Place location is wonderful.

name: Morgan Cordle
text: Waitress was rushed. Lunch was okay. Atmosphere was great as always.

name: Kisha Armstead
text: In-house service is fantastic but ordering online is terrible.  I called and the girl hung up while trying to transfer me.  A second attempt only had my order messed up (egg bits instead of scrambed) and I was unable to take back.

name: Little Red
text: Great food and service

name: Joyce Alstadt
text: Slow

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about the slow service, Joyce. Can you please email us some additional information at customercare@crackerbarrel.com? Please use your review username as your subject line, and include: phone number, email address, store location, as well as any additional information you’d like to share with us.

name: Danielle Richey
text: They have great food and are reasonably priced. They have wonderful employees who are very courteous. You have to wait for your food because they cook it to order. So be prepared.

name: Marty Thomas
text: Not good food at all. Cold and old

name: WILLIAM L. ROTENBERRY
text: Consistent , Country Home Cooked Meals !

name: Tyler Harris
text: Delicious food and good service.

name: johnny appleseed
text: I love cracker barrel and eat at our local one at least once a week. Also while traveling we will stop and spend some time with them. My first major complaint is for some reason they have changed bacon. Terrible now, if it ain't broke don't fix it.

name: Annakah Jones
text:
My server wasn't very helpful and the food wasn't good- undercooked sausage, eggs were rubbery, the pancakes were cold, and the coffee was burnt. The friendliest people seemed to be the ones at the register in the store area who did a very good job managing the stress of the store and up-selling.

Everything was clean and well-kept, but this wasn't a good visit at all.

name: Haley Bugg
text: Cracker barrel never disappoints in my eyes. Consistently great food/service.

name: Jackie Goodman
text: It was very good and the employee are friendly

name: Judy Williams
text: They have delicious food and very friendly people

name: janice osborn
text: I ordered hamburger steak, mashed potatoes, pinto beans, cornbread. Potatoes were cold so I asked for some fresh ones, the waitress brought me a bowl that had been put in the microwave that was steaming hot  🔥 and handed them to me on the tray. I went to pick them up and almost dropped them. Could not even eat them. And I love cracker barrel but that was a bad experience just glad I was not burn from them. Also there was a guy came over to my table said he was the manager in the back he was laughing and said he was sorry and it was his fault.

name: Rachael Dail
text: Basically this is like every other cracker Barrell I've ever visited. This restaurant is very good at maintaining standards no matter which one you visit. Nice and helpful staff.

name: Kevin Taylor
text: Food great as always. Our waitress was subpar to say the least. Service very slow and never got our biscuits we asked for 3 times and just gave up... lol... but the food we got was very good.

name: Jacky Richardson
text:
Service was good and kelp my coffee cup filled
The atmosphere  was very pleasing.

name: Donna Bennett
text: Food was cold.. not good. Service was good.. but that's it. Very disappointed.

name: Sonya Henderson
text: Love the food and atmosphere.

name: Vanessa Brown
text: Who doesn't love a Cracker Barrel?!?!? Great food and shopping all at one location is hard to beat.

name: Linda Johnson
text: I love green beans. Although the chicken n dumplings had an underlying cinnamon taste...must have gotten too close to the apples.

name: Michael E Panigoni
text: Love that I can eat breakfast for dinner!

name: Kim Curtis
text: I called my order in, I arrive at the store 20 min later. After a 55min combined total I ask about my (dipped not cooked) food, the 2 at front just calls says marks still waiting.  OK 15 mins later I ask how long will it be? He says I can't walk back n see, so the girls says say thing again, but yet still does not ask how much longer.  After 1hr 30 for beans dumplings and slaw, I ask for my money back on card. Then food comes around corner.  I get in car get to red light and look in bag, all my food was not there.   I turn around go back and get it..  Not once did a manager take to me or offer apology..  If they had been busy OK but they were not.  I have never had a bad exp6here til today..  So female manager worker 01/03/19 @3 pm you need to train yourself and employees to at least act like they give 2 S....   About customers.  This is unacceptable. If it happens again, I will never return.

name: Shane Haddock
text: Good service, good food and clean. Will be back again

name: TOmmy Elliott
text: Best service ever. Food was great even my grand daughters ate very good. Thanks.

name: Emmanuel Jones
text: Love the down south country food.

name: Arlington Gilbreath
text: Good food, quick service

name: David Pankratz
text: Great food and customer service!!

name: Karen Farmer
text: Good food, nice servers. Don't expect fast delivery of food, but worth the wait.

name: Dublin Burgess
text: Our waitress was excellent and so was our breakfast!

name: rex lewis

name: Josi Bee
text: Best breakfast you can get! Had the country fried steak. Friendly and attentive service, food was delicious, atmosphere great as always. Loved it!

name: Susan Hughes
text: Always have a great experience with service and quality food.0

name: A.M. Orr
text: Wonderful food, great staff and a beautiful, clean, family friendly restaurant!  The only negative is that it's always busy and there's usually a wait, but that's because everyone knows how enjoyable it is.

name: Daniel Cobb
text: Good food, good staff

name: Dena Wilson
text: Great food and good service. As is the case anywhere you go, depends on your server to the quality of service. But still a favorite place to eat and shop!

name: Sarajane Stem

name: Ernesto Ramos III

name: Cameron Moody
text: Staff is amazing, food is fair, speed is horrible! Past two times here one being a Monday other on a Wednesday it took over 1 hr each time...

name: Cindy Watkins Turner
text: Listen my husband and i LOVE this place!

name: DORIS CRITTENDEN
text: So delicious! Service was better than last time.Last time bad experience in waiting for desert for 20 minutes to he told they were out if it.😳I love the Cracker Barrel !

name: Steve Kennedy
text: We ordered fried catfish. It was very good! Great service and very clean!

name: Jennifer Stites
text: My worst Cracker Barrel experience to date. My fiance and I were told "grab a menu and seat yourselves." After five minutes, a waitress finally came by asking if someone had gotten our drink order yet, no one had, she took our drink order. Another waitress brought our drinks and took our order. A third brought our food, which was cold. We were left without refills for the entire meal. I wanted dessert, but none was offered or suggested.  10 minutes after we decided we were done, our check was brought and we were told to have a good night. I have always been a fan of eating at this restaurant, but after rude service, cold food and no refills, we will probably never be back.

name: Brian West
text: What isn't there to love about cracker barrel? They have great service at this location and great tasting well cooked food. I always love shopping for little nicnac gifts in the gift shop after. Some of it its pretty fun to play with, with the family.

name: Mike Herring
text: GOOD place for family to eat, sometimes a short wait very busy. Excellent service!

name: Glenda Brown
text: Good food good service

name: Sierra Lawson
text: Service was great and the food was wonderful today.

name: josh pate
text: Great food and friendly staff me and my family love going here to eat always a great experience

name: Sandra Autry
text: Always good! Had pancakes with peaches for dinner. Yum.

name: Hannah Yoo
text:
The service was nice and waitress was attentive.
What bothered me the most was that they seemed to have salted the ham, making it almost inedible which is hard for me because I'm pretty good at not being picky. Ham is cured with salt and does not need to be sprinkled with more salt when you prepare it for the dish. The smoked sausage had a funny taste and was overly dry, I handed that one over to my boyfriend. Their gravy had a very peculiar sweetness to it, which threw me for a loop.
The pancakes were the saving grace though and the sole reason for giving 3 stars. Delicious! I'll go back for just those, I'll know not to order anything with meat or gravy.

name: Carl Hanback
text: Greatest restaurant for home cooking and homecoming with the Family and Friends. Me my Wife and my Mother visit there often. All of the food is excellent and have a superb gift shop I know you will appreciate.

name: Nicole Littrell
text: Always good!!!

name: Matthew L.
text: Everything you would expect from a Cracker Barrel. This one is well managed and operated. Staff are very friendly. Only downside is the occasional wait, but what can ya do, really?

name: Anonny Moss
text: Always loved Cracker Barrel. Waitresses were fantastic, working with our orders to give us the best price (more bang for our buck).

name: Linda W.
text: The one in Florence when we ate there last Sunday , the food was cold. Coffee took a while to get refills. They must have newer people since the last time we ate there.

name: Celena Tovar
text: Was not the best experience tonight.(9/10/18) Food was brought out in spurts,  salads barely beat the main dish to the table.  There was 8 of us and 5 were served first while the rest waited on ours. Food was cold when brought to table,  I don't know if the server forgot to ring some of our orders in or if it was a kitchen mistake,  but we were not offered an explanation. We eat there a lot but I dont think we will be going back for awhile.  (Not to mention the below temp food could make us sick)

name: Peggy Jones-McCollum
text: Food has no taste. Server was not a good server. Our tea ran out and she only came back to the table once after our order was brought out. We had to ask someone else for tea. She didn't ask if we want any desert.

name: Maria Lepore
text:
Very friendly staff. They had the chimney going on for this bitter cold. (january 18) Good food.
My second visit:
The servers are usually very nice, but today we had an extremely nice server, the best on CB from this location so far. Her name was Ashlynn. Superb customer service. Made our visit a very pleasant one.

name: Jbird bird
text: Service be a little slow.  Food was good

name: Betty Jo
text: Ordered breakfast. All very good.

name: Ashley Graves
text: I love this place great food nice staff but expect to have a wait

text: I cook all their food at home. So I dont eat hear much only if I'm traveling.

name: James Wallace

name: TJ
text: We get our orders to go most times when we come here. We usually have big orders and most times at other places something is always left off! But each time we come here they actually HAVE what's on the menu and it's always in our bag when we get home if we ordered it.... That may not seem like a big deal but to people who eat out a lot you'll know things are left off allllll the time! So I appreciate this place a ton! Thanks CB!

I always enjoy going to Cracker Barrel
the service is really good, the food is wonderful, and it doesn't matter if there is just two people or eighty school students , they always accommodate us.

My husband is fine with that but, does want me to learn how to cook cornbread💪❣️lol lol lol

Perfecto!

text: It was okay. My breakfast (eggs, grits, gravy) was stone cold. Butter on gits would not melt. I'll be honest though, I never gave them a chance to make it right because I'm shy and didn't want to raise the issue as well as being on a time crunch and didnt have another 20 min to spare. For this reason I didnt score one star as I didnt give them the opportunity to rectify my complaint.

name: Michael Stewart
text: The service is slow and unwelcoming. The managerial staff doesn't seem to care about the attitude the employees show toward the customers and be prepared for a wait if you want a to go order. Not once, not twice, but the three times we've placed a to go order it has been wrong and twice the wait time they gave when we called the order in. While you're waiting there the employees are rude and do the bare minimum of their job requirements. Also trying to speak to Barron Hamilton is almost impossible because when something is going wrong in the store he always seems to be in a meeting or unable to deal with the problem at hand and don't except for him to call you back either because that won't happen. I feel this is where the problem stems from, bad management!

text: I usually love this locations food.  The staff is great but tonight the person that was working did not care about her job.  The hot dogs were not made like a sneaky pete should be. The buns were not warmed. We will not be eating there again if the same person is working. My children have food allergies and i repeatedly mentioned no oins and it was on the ticket.  All the hot dogs had onions.  She was to concerned about talking on the phone.

text: Just love that chicken and they got great prices.

name: Terresa Edwards
text: The food is great with excellent service.

name: Raymond Danner
text: Good food, great people.

name: Eriq
text: First Time visitors. The staff is very attentive 😷😷and friendly. Very  clean social distancing restaurant. I was  on a mission to find the best ribs in Alabama and it seems this is #1 on my list. I knew this had to be true because the drive through was lined up around the corner. For a sure sign of good food!   We chose to get our order to go. Our food was hot 🔥 well cooked if anything was thrown away was some empty containers with bones of course. My family 👪🏾and I will highly recommend their services.

name: Bill Freeman
text:
Got the Half Chicken, Collards and Beans.
Collards and Beans were excellent.
Chicken over cooked and dry. You know when put heavy sauce on their hiding something. Like Dry Chicken.
When you order Half Chicken, you expect, Leg, Thigh, Wing and Breast. Received Leg, Wing, Breast and Breast. All over cooked...

name: Jack Davis
text: I stopped here for the first time on Saturday evening 17 April 2021.  I ordered the puled pork plate as was looking forward to some good pulled pork.  Unfortunately I did not get it here.  The pulled pork is probably the worst I have ever had.  The slaw was inedible.  In fact, the slaw was horrible.  I do not know what all they put in it, but whatever it is, they need to stop.  Get a real slaw recipe.  The only reason I gave this two stars is the baked beans ands I have had better baked beans.

name: Nicholas Jordan
text: The food is DELICIOUS.  Nothing bad to say about it whatsoever.   I really enjoyed my barbecue pulled pork sandwich with pickles and a side of baked beans.

name: K9 731
text: The pork baked potato was enormous and pretty good. I haven't had a potatoe that large before but I have had better....still good and filling.

name: Sara K
text: The only thing worth getting is the chow chow salad/Cole slaw they make. The pies suck and the BBQ is mediocre. If you're looking for something better than Sonny's BBQ, don't come here.

name: kamaya kay
text: Overall, not bad. The potato salad and coleslaw need some help. The ribs were undercooked. But baby the brisket sandwich and smoked chicken were delicious. Don't know what chow chow is, but it's made perfectly with the brisket.

name: Lala Singletary
text:
Great food, bit customer service need a little work mainly food preparation..
Only because drive-thru was messed up that day couldn't use it had to go in place your order or call it in before you get there and I still had to wait and while waiting I noticed some people that were there before me and some of the orders were getting mixed up and it progressed was moving or rather slowly!!
So full moon only gets four thumbs up 👍👍👍👍

name: Davis Short
text: Very good but they neglect to give you sauce. Been about 4-5 times and got sauce once. So be sure to buy your own or ask for extra. Very dry without sauce.

name: tory white
text: Well after waiting an hour, after placing our order and sitting at our table with our numbers, someone came and checked on us. 20 minutes later they came and checked on us again. 20 minutes after that they finally brought our food. Mine was still warm, but I was the only one. Every one at our table’s food was cold. So not sure if they were short handed or disorganized. Just curious why we had numbers placed on our tables if they come over to use 3 times to ask what we ordered and our receipt. So I would not recommend dinning in, might have better luck with drive through.

name: Qiana Law
text: I went for Mother’s Day and it was messy. The front wasn’t clean. All the workers arguing and not wanting to come to the register to assist those coming in. One customer did an online order and he had been waiting over 30 minutes just for an employee to catch an attitude with him about HIS order. And the same employee decides she was going to clock out and go home in the process of taking orders. I wasn’t satisfied as they messed up my order and I tried calling Corporate and got no response either. I would honestly never go back and being Corporate never reached back out after I left two voicemails I will be sure to let family and friends know this is not the place to go.

name: David Nelson
text: Have eaten here many times and always had excellent food, today the bbq wings were cold, soggy and the taste was off, I wouldn't even give the wings 1 star. Everything else was 5 stars.

name: judiharden
text:
Saturday Night. Crazy busy.  Large order. Great Food.
Thank you.
See you soon

name: Carla Michelle
text: This food is delicious. We were road tripping and I will be sure to pass through there again.  Forgot to take pictures. 🥰🥰🥰🥰

name: Dani Koson
text:
Overall, a pretty solid place! Greens were good, the baked beans were smokey and addictive, and the breading on the catfish was flavorful. The house made tartar sauce had a nice zesty kick to it. The cornbread was just sweet enough (though it could've been a little bigger). Pork and ribs were smokey, tender, and delicious. The chow-chow was spicy and so good! There were only a couple detractions. One was the fact that the chow-chow didn't seem to come with every dinner plate (or at least not the fish?). The other major flaw was their mac & cheese and french fries. A little bit if Cajun seasoning or anything beyond salt and pepper would've made these sides more interesting. Instead they were quite bland.

But again, for the money you pay, it's not a bad meal. Most of your options will have your taste buds doing a happy dance.

name: Jim Williams
text:
Went there last Sunday afternoon about 4pm
Very disappointed with the food.
It was our first visit there.
Ordered the baby back ribs and loaded baked potato
The tray our food was served on were warped and our drinks spilled everywhere.
Baby back ribs were not even close to being warm, and were dried out. Some were only 11/2 “ long...
Baby baby baby back ribs.
The baked potato skin was so hard I broke my plastic knife trying to cut it. Could not even stab my fork into it.
It had been sitting for a long long time.
We were very surprised the food was so bad, the reviews were good.
Never again will we eat there, first and last time...
Don’t waste your money.

resp.text: Hi Jim, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Molly Cox
text: Why oh why can’t I post 0 stars. I paid $23 at this restaurant only to be given raw, pink meat?? My husband works night shift at the medical center and I grabbed him his favorite food which is bbq chicken so he’d have something filling before work and now he had to throw it away! On top of the fries being cold, old and without any salt and he couldn’t even tell his macaroni and any cheese on it smh 🤦🏽‍♀️

name: Stephan Myers
text: Wanted a quick bite to eat that wasn't a hamburger.  Full Moon BBQ fit the bill.  My son and I both got a big baker with BBQ pork.  They were both huge potatoes stuffed with pork, sour cream, butter and chives.  The food was ordered at the counter and brought to the table by a friendly server.  Meat was perfectly smoked a the sauce tangy but not overly spicy. Great food but be prepared to be stuffed when you leave.

name: Meagan Watson
text: Great BBQ! Portions are HUGE! Cookies are the BEST ever!

name: W A
text: Always good food! Friendly service as well. Fairly quick with food delivery except when super packed. I definitely suggest giving it a try.

name: Tabitha Hunter
text: The food was okay. I had the bbq pork sandwich with baked beans. The sandwich was okay but the baked beans were horrible. They smelled and tasted burnt! I’ve never had burnt baked beans.

name: Pilot Alabama
text: This place used to be awesome. It’s REALLY gone downhill. I couldn’t eat half the meat on these spare ribs because they were stringy and the consistency of jerky. That’s NOT an exaggeration. And the Mac n cheese was bland and dry. I won’t be coming back here again and will recommend to everyone that asks to go elsewhere for bbq. It’s disappointing, but I really can’t believe it’s this bad. I don’t remember having worse bbq anywhere from the west to east coasts. Management really needs to get their quality under control.

resp.text: Hello Pilot Alabama, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Cecil High
text:
The selection of food items is outstanding. We like the  giant loaded baked potato. Loaded with
chicken or BBQ pork and everything thats makes for a great meal. One potato feeds two hungry people and its very reasonably priced.

name: James walker
text: It's a shame that I had to come back and edit my review. Whoever is in the kitchen cooking today needs to be fired. The ribs were hard and you guys potato salad tastes like you bought it from Walmart.

name: marc powers
text: Great food. Most employees are nice and caring

name: NicoOutside
text: Ribs were decent. Food was hot and fresh. Drive thru guy was very helpful and friendly.

name: Mike Simon
text: Great food. Loved the bbq pork plate. Clean place.

name: jc's so good kitchen
text: Terrible service I waited 30 minutes on 4 hot dogs and it was flies everywhere I thought a dead animal was in there 4 people just walked out before me the was messing up every body's order I just told them keep them lil 8 dollars they just need to close down a lil girl at a lemonade stand is more organized than them throw the whole store away

text: Pulled pork sandwich was excellent with the baked beans. And pulled chicken sandwich was just that's good mac and cheese very good. And the deviled eggs

name: Tracey Trammell
text: I recently stopped by Full Moon in Dothan Al. For lunch. I  proceeded to pay with gift card, had an issue with card and I  gave the manager, Jermal the receipt and he handled the situation very quickly and professionally. It is so hard these days to find employees that care and respect their employment but Jermal was exceptional. Definitely enjoyed the food and  great hospitality.

name: Christopher Parker
text:
This place is amazing...
The chicken and brisket...OMG

name: J E
text: Such great food at reasonable prices.  Fast service and friendly people.  Lots of sports channels on the large TVs.

name: Lesli Turner Vance
text: Chicken sandwich made to perfection.   Tender as it can be.

name: Bob Boyle
text: The food is great but when the drive through attendant can't wear a face mask correctly it makes me wonder about what they think of their customers. I would have given 5 stars otherwise.

resp.text: Hi Bob, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: David Hanna
text: Awesome food wish we had one in California

name: Donna Lehneis
text: First of all, let me start by saying my food was delicious.  I loved the brisket, and the riblets.  The sauce was fantastic.  That being said, management should take a long hard look at their customer care standard of treatment.   I place our dine in order and immediately after placed a take out order.  Spent $75 all total.  After asking a waitress twice about my to go order and then having to go up to the counter because they didn't come back to my table to advise status.  I recieve an attitude from the waitress working the pass that "they were busy", "I am waiting on these dine in orders" pointing to the front counter where 3 trays of food were sitting.  I said, "I've been waiting now for an hour since my order was placed, I would like my food so I can leave". She turned around and ignored me.  The manager came over and asked what I was waiting for and I told him, "My Togo order"  He said "we are behind on to go orders, I said I understand,  but I placed my order an hour ago when I place my dine in order and have been finished now for over 30 minutes"  he said "oh, your food should have already been up".  No kidding.  As much as I enjoyed the food, I will not return to this restaurant due to their poor customer service.

resp.text: Hi Donna, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Hannah Gilley
text: They served my daughter a extremely undercooked burger tonight. Will not be returning.

name: Bill Klein
text: You never know what your going to get. Ordered take out for Sundays NFL games. Ordered wings that were not completely cooked, ordered mac and cheese very bland. It’s a flip of the coin whether its going to be good or bad. When it’s good, it’s very good. We have received more bad then good I'm sorry to say. Zero consistency. I think we’re are done ordering from Full Moon Bar-B-Que on Montgomery Hwy.

resp.text: Hi Bill, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Cat Mama
text: The staff is always nice here and the food is amazing! Love that they have a convenient drive thru! Love the Chow Chow!!!!

name: Karen Parsons
text: A friend and I had great BBQ pork sandwiches, fries and tea the other day. The sandwich had an abundance of shredded pork. We had excellent,  personal service by Latasha.  She is definitely an asset  with her friendly and positive attitude! Will definitely be back!

name: Ed Egee
text: Simply some of the best barbeque anywhere. Food is excellent. We had brisket, spare ribs, deviled eggs, catfish and Mac and cheese. Everything is good. One minor suggestion: digital ordering. The wait in line isnt great. Tablets at the tables would be better.

name: Melissa Sawyer
text: Horrible customer service. I normally dont leave bad reviews but this deserves it. They would not take our order and ignored us.

resp.text: Hi Melissa, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Mr. D
text:
Full Moon is still my favorite chain BBQ joint, but we had the Big Baker potatoes yesterday and they were extremely disappointing. The potatoes were very dry and they were practically devoid of any pulled pork. Of course COVID-19 protocols made the visit far less enjoyable to no fault of their own.

We make the hour and forty-five minute drive from PCB once or twice a month and we dine here virtually every time. I think that’s going to change after this last experience. I’m not sure what has happened but it has definitely changed and not for the better.

On a side note. Both the men’s and women’s restrooms were absolutely filthy. There’s absolutely no excuse for that!

resp.text: Hi, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Emma Ritchie
text:
Overpriced & rude employees. No customer service attitude to be seen.
Lady in the drive through was in too big of a hurry to understand what my husband was trying to do with his meal in the two meat combo. Then acted like it was a problem to add in something at the window that I had already told her I wanted in the first place. Rolled her eyes and everything. Overpriced, again. And not worth the headache trying to order.
Came in 10/25 6:23pm.

name: Kimberly Stewart
text: I don’t even know where to start really. We have ate here since it’s opened up. We will drive from enterprise just to get dinner or buy a whole pie.  But there’s definitely been a change since they have opened back up.  Food quality isn’t as good and today we drove 30 miles to eat here and got there at 140 stood in line as others ordered and sat to wait on there meals. We got to the register and a man came from the back and ask if we were eating there. Like that wasn’t obvious we were.so we said yes and he replied were closed. We thought he was joking with us as many others were eating and the people ahead of us went right over and sat down to eat. As he walked us to the door basically  pushing us out he said see it says we close at 230 on Sunday and went back inside.. it’s now 155 pm... I don’t know what’s going on here but they have lost my business...

resp.text: Hello Kimberly, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Sandra Robertson
text: My husband and I get Full Moon every Saturday night, including this one. We have definitely noticed a decline in quality but tonight is the absolute worst experience so far. My husband’s ribs were extremely undercooked. I, on the other hand, had the potato with chicken. I noticed that the potato tasted like it had been rewarmed, and then I noticed that the chicken looks raw. I decided to save the chicken in a plastic bag in case I get sick. After placing the chicken in the bag, I smelled it and it smells rotten. I am praying we don’t get sick. I will NEVER eat here again.

text: Excellent! Everything was fresh and tasted great! Pork sandwich was moist and very tasty. Steak fries and baked beans were hot and fresh.

name: Robert Parker
text:
Today was a disappointing dining experience beginning with the young lady taking our order.  During the order she’d taken our order incorrectly twice that we understood and then after lunch delivered to our table realized actually three times.  My wife had ordered Caesar salad with grilled chicken tenders.  The young lady taking our order even asked what kind of dipping sauce would you like?  The salad was delivered to our table without chicken tenders. The gentleman who’d delivered to our table said he’d be back in a few minutes with the tenders.  Twenty three minutes later we left without the chicken.
Perhaps extenuating circumstances lead to this extremely poor service such as masks muffling our voices, plastic partition, loud background music and maybe the young lady just didn’t care.  Idk.  But I do know we won’t be back. As in Dothan Alabama there are plenty of good alternatives to have a good meal with reasonably good service.

text: Took a BBQ tour from North Florida to Memphis and stopped at many places along the way. Full Moon had THE BEST pulled pork sandwich. The "regular" was huge. We also tried the BBQ nachos, I am ready for that trend to fad it always ends up not what it could have been. Now if they did a shredded chicken nachos with that white sauce, we could talk about it. Sausage and cheese plate was exactly that, more tradition than anything, sausage was a little spicy. Also took carrot cake home, it hits it out of the park for sure!

name: Sam Davis
text: This is typically my favorite place to eat. When I walked in today things were different. It was a bit messier and had a slightly foul smell. I ordered a pound of brisket and a half pound of sausage. The barbecue sauce tasted scorched. The brisket was not fully sliced and was unusually dry and bland. The sausage lacked the snap it normally has. It was like an oversized Slim Jim. I was there at lunch, but I feel like I was served yesterdays leftovers. It may be a long while before I go back.

name: Christopher DiNatale
text:
After looking through the reviews it seems the majority of the 1 star reviews have come recently. It's a shame because we were told this was the best BBQ in Alabama. I unfortunately am going to disagree with that claim.

We ordered take out for a party we were having. Several pounds of pulled pork and pulled chicken. The BBQ was ok, nothing spectacular. We did however have quite a few bones in both the chicken and pork which was alarming since we have young children who were also eating the food. I will say that the sauce itself was pretty good. So there was at least one positive.

The real disappointment with this establishment came to the bill. Total for our order was $150 which was split with another party. Rather than charging myself $75 and the other party $75, they charged me $150, then charged me again $75, then charged me again another $75. The other part was double charged as well. Upon complaining to Full Moon, I was told that I was not charged multiple times and that it was an issues with both my bank, and the other parties bank. It's now the next week and they are still in fact trying to charge my bank the additional charges, that is per my bank.

Would you like to pay over $400 for only $150 of sub-par BBQ? Probably not. I'd make this restaurant a hard pass if I'm ever again in the Dothan area.

resp.text: Hi Christopher, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to reach out to our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com with your preferred method of contact to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Den Davidson
text: I've been to this restaurant many times and had a great experience each time but tonight was very different. The cashier that took our order was so preoccupied with complaining about another customer who complained about getting their order wrong that she didn't even ask us if she could take our order. After some uncomfortable wait for her to acknowledge us I finally gave up and just blurted out my order which she took while she steamed. We then seat ourselves at a filthy dining room table that we had to wipe off ourselves. So then we get our chicken sandwiches we ordered and discovered the buns were soggy because the person that prepared them was too lazy to toast the bun like usual. Didn't dare complain after witnessing how the other customer was treated . Besides I was worried they might do something bad to my food.  Doubt I'll be back even though my wife and I eat here at least 3 times a month. Would love to hear from somebody in management. I have my receipt and can tell you who waited on me.

resp.text: Hi Den, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing director at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We'd love to hear from you.

name: Tom Miller
text: When I was in Dothan traveling home I wound up staying at the Marriott so I asked the front manager where was a good BBQ place to checkout as I wanted to sample some Alabama BBQ and they told me Full Moon BBQ it's just around the corner so I went there based on their suggestion. I'm kinda open to new places and exploring as long as the food is great and the place is clean. Didn't take me too long to find it overall the place was nice and clean but it had a tourist trap vibe sadly most of the places in this area trying to compete for your almighty dollars. I'm more into comfort food cafeteria style food and awesome BBQ but none to be found that I knew about in this area so I decided for this place. Wish I could sample the food at places to decide what tasted awesome? I got a Brisket chicken platter. The food was not bad good portions self serve on drinks and BBQ sauces to me a little pricey but overall not bad but to me it kinda lacked a smoked flavor? I've eaten a lot of BBQ over the years and I know good BBQ. Overall, the place had a bunch of celebrity pictures on the wall with TV's in the corner kinda felt more like a sports bar than a BBQ place? The place was clean and probably not a bad place to take a friend or meet up with someone as it was convenient but depends what you are looking for and how picky you are in great BBQ. So the quest for better BBQ goes on next time I'm in the area for a better place.

name: Larry Clark
text: When my family came to visit from Kentucky they had a craving for barbeque. I knew just where to take them. Upon arrival you'll notice the smoke coming from the chimney, exhaust from the in house smoker, and a slight aroma of a outdoor style BBQ. When you enter the building you'll immediately smell the BBQ, the smell alone makes your mouth water. They have a large menu board and paper menus available to select from. The pricing is a little high, but the portions are large. Everything on the menu is delicious. You order and pay at the counter and are handed a number to place on your table. Then the food is brought to the table. Needless to say my family was very impressed and all agreed they would have to return to Full Moon next time they visited. Oh, and try the white BBQ sauce.

resp.text: This makes us very happy to hear we have new fans in Kentucky! Thank you for choosing our BBQ to share! See you all again soon!

I wouldn't go every time I needed a BBQ fix, but I would recommend it to anyone on that side of town.

Best Barbecue ever.
Also one of the clearest Restaurants I have been to.
We come here every other week to eat all the way from panama city.

text: This was our first visit we have been disappointed.  The food took quite a while to get to us, we usually get it in 5 minutes or so, it was closer to 20 minutes. text: Very quick service and extremely friendly staff. Food is excellent and portions are large. Great atmosphere and just a good place to eat

text: Love, love the food at this place, only downside is they consistently get my order wrong.

text: Pretty pricey for a simple meal and it was disappointing to be served our food on a peice of paper on the plastic red tray. For $25 for two sandwiches, fries and teas it would have been great to have had at least a plate. The food is good..but probably my last visit.
