name: Michael Britt
text: Really good service. If they're busy always check your order before leaving!

name: Shirley Litton Bodine
text:
The minute we walked in one of the employee's started running her mouth making sure that we heard her.  I have a disability due to a TBI along with PTSD.  I had my service dog in my arm's.  She immediately started running her mouth saying "THAT DOG HAS NO BUSINESS IN A RESTAURANT WHO DOES SHE THINK SHE IS!" She kept running her mouth & staring at me as she walked by.  I even told her that she's a service dog and I showed her the badge & turned my service dog around so she could see the vest.  Yet she just kept on & had the AUDACITY TO SAY she didn't care what the badge and vest said!!  My husband asked for the manager.  One of the other ladies who was up front called for him.  My husband proceeded to tell him that evidently he needs to educate her & other employees about service dog's because "BY LAW" your ONLY REQUIRED TO ASK 2 THING'S.
1.  "IS THAT A SERVICE DOG"
2.  WHAT DOES THE DOG DO?
NOTHING MORE.
She continued to stare while we were eating & when my husband went back up there to place another order she was staring him down too. Such uneducated ignorance on her part along with plenty of other customer's who heard her & witnessed it all.  What a BAD EXAMPLE SHE SET AS AN EMPLOYEE AT THIS JACK'S.

resp.text: Thanks for this feedback, Shirley. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and will have our team looking into this immediately. We hope to see ya again soon. -JRAE

text: 2 fridays ago went thru drive thru ordered chicken.girl said we don't have chicken.i said o.k.do you not have any chicken in the restaurant  or are you cooking  more and can I wait?she said "I don't know".wow! I left came bac nxt note ordered 2 pc.dinner all breast.got charged  xtra for breast.thats fine.got home leg and a thigh chicken was like wood the biscuit like a rock.the 4th time I've had quality issues not at any other  jacks.will not be a 5th time.drive thru cashiers don't speak to u when u pull up.tell u the total.i always thank them when receiving  my change cant even acknowledge  u ! I worked for Jack's for 7 yrs.started n hoover worked up into management. My own store in alabaster and helped open the Pelham location.This store is a serious  joke with the attitudes  and quality of food.good luck in future sales.i think the high school football games is the only thing giving you a boost if u can find out if the restaurant  has no chicken in house or being dropped to order or if u can wait for it."I DONT KNOW".

text:

THEY LOOK  OFF INTO SPACE WHEN THEY TAKE ORDERS FROM COSTOMER AND DANCE AND SING TO ETHER THE MUSIC THERE  OR TO THEIR OWN.  THEY ARE YEALING TO ONE ANOTHER
WHEN YOU ASK FOR HELP TO PLACE AN ORDER YOU ARE INTERFERING WITH THEIR PERSONAL TIME.

text: It was good but the trash tray had no designated place for the food trays to be placed after use. The workers were loud and they were playing around. The people and the community around the Jacks are very nice and respectful, and one of the workers was even nice enough to hold the door for me. name: Rebecca Barkey
text: I've been to this Jack's numerous times, the FOOD is always pretty good, but, I do have a complaint about what I received tonight. I got a milkshake & my daughter got a chicken finger dinner. With green beans and mashed potatoes. They handed the milkshake to my husband, who just put it in the cupholder while he got the other food & passed it to me. I checked to he sure all the food was there & we pulled out of the parking lot. I went to pick up my shake & noticed it was WAY overfilled, and the top had been forced on to where the shake was running all down the sides. There was seriously no way I could drink it without it pouring out all over me. It had leaked all down in his cupholder, then it leaked all over his floorboards & down my leg. I reached on the bag to get napkins to try & minimize the damage, but..  lo and behold... they didn't bother to give us any. I wasn't dressed, or I would've made him turn around and go back. The mess from this shake was ridiculous. I had to wait for hubby to go inside & get paper towels so I could wrap the shake to bring it in the house. Then my daughter opened her box & there was no fork with which to eat her mashed potatoes and green beans. So, bottom line. Food is good. Attention to detail, not so much.

resp.text: We strive to provide the best service. We'll be taking your experience into consideration as we work to improve. -JRSK

name: Dana Bice
text: My husband and I went in last week one evening after work to grab a bite to eat. The manager on duty was very loud  he had an all male staff that were busy as bees but he kept getting really loud and hateful with them. The manager seemed to be the problem. Constantly complaining about being busy. We just wanted to get some supper and eat in peace but that didn’t happen. It took over 10 minuets to get my husbands burger after they had already put his fries and my plate on the tray and it  just sat on the counter getting cold, I didn’t say anything because I knew they were busy and I was tired. When they did get the burger it was cold, I thought they were waiting on meat to cook or something but that wasn’t the case. I’m sure these employees were shutting down on their manager. They had enough! We normally get good food. If you treat your employees well and with respect they will take care of you the customer.

name: Donna Barber
text: They use to be the best at great food and accuracy of orders. On June 1, 2019, I went thru the drive thru to order a milkshake and the truck ahead of me in line apparently was friends with the young, long haired gentleman working the window. Not being a smoker probably agitated me even more but the guy driving the truck handle his disgusting VAPE cigarette to the worker who took a big breath of the vape and blew it back out the window. I don't like anyone handling my food or drink with cigarette smell or vape germs on my food. I should have told the manager but I did not. A more mature young woman was behind him bagging food and she had to know he did this. However, its my own fault for not reporting. Please make sure they know this is not appropriate and also is probably a violation from the county health department. I'm sure this is an isolated incident but I will report it to the health dept, of it ever happens again.

name: William Greenlee
text: Last visit was really good. Wings, although small, are really, really good. Barbecue sandwich was good and so was the coleslaw. The young lady that took my order was friendly as well.  Hopefully she can train the staff from the first visit. I hope your move goes well and I look forward to continuing to order from the local business.

text: Food is always delicious and served with a smile!

name: Agee Whim
text: The best food in the southwest

resp.text: Thanks for the review 🙌🏾

name: Rachel Ward
text: First time ordering from here as it was highly recommended from a friend. The rib sandwich was decent, wouldn’t get it again. Did not know what chow chow was but hot damn it was delicious. Their slaw and stuffed potatoes are divine. The cashier told us to have a blessed day and that just topped the cherry on the superb customer service they have.

name: Randy Silver
text:
Good bbq and service. Meals are huge and a kids meal may satisfy you.
Clean place w well lit parking in a safe area.
Good value for price.

name: Frog Price
text:
Great dinner. We met an old friend. Menu offerings were varied. BBQ baked potato was HUGE and meaty with lots of cheese. Was served piping hot. Meat was tender and lean. BBQ sauce was just right. Wife's sandwich, fries and baked beans were delicious. Our friend got BBQ chicken. Said it was wonderful with a great texture. Was very complementary of the food.
Place was spotless during the evening rush. Restrooms were neat, clean and well stocked.
Too far away for our regular rotation but should be on our goto list.

name: Gabriel Mendez-Frances
text:
Hands down one of if not the best Bar-B-Que restaurant in Alabama. Full Moon does it all right - the food tastes great, the atmosphere is friendly, and the menu is vast and full to the brim with soul food. Full Moon is a bit pricier than most places, but it is every bit worth it. Try the half-moon cookies, if you have the space for it!

Also, I have a friend of mine who works here and it's very entertaining to pretend I don't know who she is when I stop by.

name: Angelica Martinez
text: I like the giant chicken bake potatoe. The sweet tea is delicious and the service is excellent. I like to come to this place because is clean and niece.

name: Aeronica Jones
text: This is our favorite stop for brisket, sausage, and pulled pork. We highly recommend this restaurant.  Another feel good experience on day date with hubby.

name: Stephanie R. Tinney
text:
Went to full moon again today.  This was my first putting since pandemic.   As per the usual they killed it!  In the kitchen, in our surroundings.   I love that place.  Never have I ever had a bad experience at full moon!!
#BBQloving

name: Jonathan Holland
text: I used to buy a slab of ribs a week here and they were excellent, but about the last 7 slabs have been tougher than shoe leather. I've kept trying slab after slab hoping they will improve, but nothing has changed. When you are spending $25 on a slab of ribs they should be perfect every time! There is zero margin for error with a price like that. If ever you find yourself in their Montgomery location, try their slabs of ribs because they are tender and perfect every single time.

name: Velma Wilson
text: The ribs were on point so tender, seasoned just right, the fried okra was very good. Mac and cheese was good, but not the best I have had.

name: Momma Tee
text: Had a call in order and they said it would be ready in 20 minutes. Because I was close I decided to go and be prepared to wait. I arrived 10 minutes early and once I gave her my name, I was out the door in three. That's what I call service, plus the food was just right

name: Erica Hawkins
text: Personally I thoroughly enjoyed everything I ordered, but my husband’s dinner wasn’t too appetizing. From the time I called my order in to the moment I picked it up, everything was great. The employee didn’t rush me at all, he even answered a couple of questions I asked and offered several suggestions on things to try. I am so glad I did too! Did you know they have deviled eggs? They do and they’re absolutely delicious. I ordered their rib plate and they tasted like they were just taken off the grill. My husband ordered a bbq sandwich and it was just a bit on the dry side with very little sauce. The customer service and food was great and I will be returning very soon. You should too.

name: Jennifer Murcks
text: Full Moon in Fultondale is usually a long wait. I have never been and not been put in drive-thru time out. The food however is great and the staff has always been friendly and helpful.

name: Rebekah Janicke
text: Food was good. My service was a mite slow though. I would probably eat here again. I didn't go in just went through the drive thru.

name: Anna Hinton
text: Order was for a plain bbq sandwich.  Said no slaw on sandwich.  When sandwich comes out there was slaw all over my sandwich.  I can not eat cabbage and orderd so i wouldnot get any. Was with other peopl so did not git order fixed.

name: Caroline Williamson
text: The food was delicious! Large portions, great price. The restaurant was clean and sanitized. Our server bowed and remained silent while we said grace. I will be a return customer!

name: Ryan Cass
text: I love this Full Moon BBQ location, for the past 9 years my friends and I have stopped in for lunch on our way to the World of Wheels car show and every year the BBQ here is on point. I love their smoked wings and I tried the sweet heat sauce today and it was very good with the ranch. I only wish the location in Huntsville where I’m from was as good as this location here in Fultondale.

name: Mary Sumrall
text: Great food and service!  My chicken breast was smoked and moist; the squash casserole and collards are the best around!

name: Kevin Sanders
text: The food is usually really good and good service. The problem I have is when you pay over 4 dollars for a slice of pie and you get a tiny piece that is half the size of the container it comes (which is about the size of a regular slice of pie) in. You get 10% pie , 40% whip cream, & 50% container. It sucks to pay that much money and it not last 3 bites.

name: Rebecca Valera
text: We were driving through and wanted some good lunch that we can't get in Ohio so we tried out this place. Omg. It was so good! So good in fact that we made it a point to stop there on our way back and even bought dinner for later when we were done with lunch 😂 we definitely don't get legit bbq like this in Ohio. Even got my son a shirt because he loved it so much. When he took the first bite I heard a loud mmmmmmmmm.

name: Steven
text: Today after the tornado from yesterday the crew that works this location was cooking food in their catering or portable grills in the parking lot to provide food, free of cost, to anyone in the area working. They provided this service with a smile and a great attitude. It's places like this, in times like today that remind me there are still great people out there. Thank you guys for lunch!

name: Terrance Santana
text: I visit this place a lot since I work in the area. I must say the service is always excellent and they keep the place neat constantly. Prices are reasonable and they serve large portions.

name: Stanley Taylor
text: Never been there or even heard of this place but so happy we went there.  Excellent food and service.  I highly recommend it.

name: Thomas McGill
text: Good Bar-B-Q, not great. Nice staff and atmosphere. Great place for SEC football fans.

name: JD
text: Always great food and service. Staff and owners friendly and helpful. No place better around to eat.

name: Mike S
text: Best full moon you will ever eat at .. great service always and consistently great food. Squash caserole is incredible !!! Dont have enough good things to say about this place.. dont be discouraged if ya go at lunch and its crowded.... it is crowded for reason !!!!  They move pretty swift so calm down itll be worth the wait!!

name: A. Hollis
text: Loved the ribs tips. Plenty of food, I was able to eat of it for 2 days.

name: Angie Campbell Hopkins
text: The bbq was hot and tasty. I got a slice of lemon icebox pie, it was delicious and tasted homemade.

name: Clay Maddox
text: Great food and service. Enjoyed the pork baked potato. It was a large serving. Very tasty. Employees great. Dining room clean and COVID ready with distancing at tables. Employees wearing masks.

name: corey hill
text: Omg I'm so glad they opened a location here in huntsville!

name: Jim Puckett
text: Great tasting bbq chicken sandwich, great sauce. Nice portion meals. This store would well up north. Glad we found it.

name: Crystal Byrams

name: jim tedesco

name: mary hosea

name: Emily Milhouse

name: John Douglas
text: We were glad to have stumbled upon this place on our way south. Good bbq. Alabama and Auburn are both well represented with memorabilia. Roll Tide!

name: Wayne D Chappell Jr
text: The food and service are always excellent!  Even the drive-thru on a Friday night is high speed!

name: Tim Suggs
text:
Takes "DAYS" to eat the crazy amount of food they serve you here!  True of their dessert cakes and pies too! Super Fast, Super Clean, Super Nice!

Now I'm NOT a "Chow Chow" person, and if you aren't either, BEWARE that they DO serve "Chow Chow" on their BBQ sandwiches unless you order it WITHOUT the "Chow Chow"

Best BBQ Sauce in the City! OMG you should see the size of their onion rings! HUGE!  Everybody who worked their was masked. I just had a chopped BBQ sandwich, that was perfectly, finely chopped, and my wife had their BBQ Brisket that was tender and succulent. Their squash casserole is a "Religious Experience" all unto itself.

It can be difficult to get into or out of their parking lot, but trust me, it's worth it any minor hassle that might present. WARNING...  Do NOT bring your Mama to this place to eat cause she will suddenly start slapping herself silly on the drive home after eating here!

text: Food is always delicious.  Drive thru speed is hit or miss, but overall I enjoy eating from here.

Full moon
yesterday was really BAD the meat has really tough Now a

text: Pulled pork was underseasoned without bbq sauce. But the sides were really good and so was the sliced turkey.

name: Elizabeth Douglas
text: This is by far the best BBQ in the Gardendale/Fultondale area. The food is always amazing and the service is speedy considering they’re almost always have a packed house. Anything I’ve ever ordered has been excellent. The portions are generous, the sauce is delicious, and the meat is always done to perfection. The sandwiches and ribs are especially good. Last night, I ordered a salad with turkey, and was amazed at just how delicious and fresh it was. The turkey was so tender and so juicy. The greens and tomatoes were crisp and ripe, and the shredded cheese and the blue cheese dressing were outstanding. Full moon is always a good bet!

resp.text: Hi Elizabeth, we're so glad you had a great experience at our Fultondale Full Moon! Be sure to take home some of our award-winning desserts at your next visit!

name: April Hatcher
text: I visited this Full Moon in Fultondale because I was in the area, I decided to go in to place a to-go order since the drive-thru line was rather long.  To my surprise, there were at least 2 families of 3 or more members that entered after me and none of the 2 families had on a mask.  But the website simply states under Health and Safety "mask required".  They were not asked to put on a mask or was not refused service because they weren't wearing masks!  This goes against all CDC guidelines.  And it made me EXTREMELY uncomfortable because we are still in a pandemic where millions have contracted COVID and died.  I will be filing a complaint with the board of health asap.  Obviously this establishment is putting money/business before safety/health of customers.

text: As a Texas resident, I decided to see what Alabama bbq was all about and boy was I disappointed. I had the ribs (spare & baby back) brisket and sausage link, unsauced. The meat barely had a smoke ring and none of the food had any seasoning. The bbq sauce however, was great. I had to drown my food in the sauce to enjoy it. The sides were mediocre at best. The okra was good. The one standout dish was the fried catfish. It was well seasoned and fried just right. This did not compare to Texas bbq in any way. I don't think I'll visit again.

The food is always great and comes out tasting very good, none of it is frozen as they have a very open kitchen where you can see the food being cooked as you order. It’s also very good, with white sauce being my favorite. And the veggies are very tasty, especially the okra and sweet potato casserole. my personal favorite are the “Love me tenders”. Which is chicken, by the way. The staff are always very nice to you and patient while you order. It is a very clean place with nice restrooms and a great atmosphere. Very good food and people. I will always go here while I live in this area!

name: R Matthews aka RJ
text:
Even though I have been driving by this place for over a year I never went there until recently. All I can say is unbelievable and I couldn't wait to go back.  I have gone twice the past 10 days. Currently you can only do drive through. I went to the one in Gardendale, Alabama.  But I would think that they all serve the same menu. Their food is fantastic and their prices are reasonable. I had the loaded potato with chicken and pork.  I think the chicken was better but the meal is so big you can have left overs.

Also they are practicing social distancing more than other restaurants. Overall a 5 star experience.

name: E.T. Hollander
text: Excellent chicken and white sauce.

name: Jereme Stout
text:
I have customer service issues and product issues with this place.

First we were feeding a large group and the cashier kindly recommended that we get a few family packs and then upgrade our 2 pints to 2 quarts for an additional $3.  We pay for the food and start reviewing the receipt as we thought the bill was high, only to notice that they charged us for 2 extra pints at full price.  Pints are 6.95, quarts are 9.95 (may not be exact to the penny but it's close).  I get the three dollar up-charge as that's the difference between the two but why would I pay nearly $14 for 2 pints (2 pints = 1 quart) when I could pay the $10 and get the same thing.  We brought this to what appeared to be the manager on duty (he had a different color shirt than everyone else) and all he would assure us of is that he would speak with the cashier and acted as if we were crazy for questioning the charges for what we received.  He made no offer to correct but only saying "what do you want me to do?".  As a customer service manager you should know full and well what to do.  On this alone I won't be back.

For the product, the brisket was cut thin (who does that) which severely limited the flavor available from the bark.  Got chopped pork, this was insanely dry.  Only saving grace is they give you almost 2 quarts of sauce - it's certainly needed.  On the only positive note, the sausages where pretty good but overall we should all expect better.

resp.text: Hi Jereme, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

They will remember they were there! Yummmm!

text: Some of the best barbecue you'll ever eat. Gotta get their baked potatoes with chow chow.

name: brenda varnado
text: Food is always fresh and awesome. Staff is very friendly restaurant was very clean

name: Kevin Lemons
text: One of the best places to eat you'll ever visit. The food is always perfect with friendly service.

name: Scott Woellert
text: Excellent food. Excellent service. Highly recommend.

name: Linda Weeks
text:
EXCELLENT SERVICE,
DELICIOUS FOOD

name: Chris Lindsey
text: Love this place.  Everything is great.  Service is great.  Food is great.  Atmosphere is great.

resp.text: Your review was GREAT, Chris! We're so pleased to hear you enjoy your visits! See you again soon!

name: Edwina Henslee
text: Always good and hot!

name: Mrz Perry
text:
8/16/18 Update

So since the representative received my info and did nothing with it I decided to shop around a bit. Whay I've found is EVERY other bbq spot that serves baked potatoes  is a better bang for your buck. I even made one at home myself and it was worth more than what I spent in time and money at this full moon. I would STRONGLY suggest driving five minutes into tarrant or 15 into roebuck for a MUCH better taste and value experience.

So I visited 7/18/18. Called my order in 20 minutes before arriving and still had 2 wait. THEN for the exact same price as Costas BBQ in Huffman I get HALF the potato... Like SERIOUSLY. It was dry, no sauce, barely any sour cream and NO butter! 😒 Can not WAIT to show the nice people there how their potatoes outrank full moon's. Smdh will NOT be going back. ✌🏾

resp.text: Hello, we sincerely apologize about your poor experience. Could you please provide your contact information to fullmoonsocialmedia@gmail.com? Our manager would like to speak with you directly.

name: Miriam Mitchell
text: The food is always hot and delicious the staff is very friendly and kind .

name: Heidi Agun
text: Brisket was tender and tasty, Service was too notch

name: Calvin Edwards
text: Great bb que and great service

name: David Danford
text: Was passing through and decided to try. Assumed its be some "generic fast food bbq" but was shocked to find it was actually some excellent southern bbq. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Hello David, thank you for your feedback! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and hope to serve you again soon!

name: Stephen Royster
text: Full Moon Bar-B-Cue taste okay. Some of their other items might be better than the pork. However, it is a high volume restaurant. It is surprising, to me, their desserts are not that good for a barbecue. Yes I know about the homemade cookies. They are good.

name: Byron Derby
text: The pork and brisket was a little dry but the spare ribs were great!

name: Lee Bryan
text: Easy stopping point on road trips for me, exit has plenty, easy traffic usually and full moon hits the spot.

name: J Williams
text: We chose this resturaunt based on a recommendation from a local.  The food was amazing

name: Ron Busby
text: Full Moon is my favorite Barbecue resteraunt. They are always well staffed, so you never have to wait for your food. Always a great dining experience.

name: Demetria Barlow
text: Fast service great bbq!  Potatoes to die for!!

name: mellisa hales
text: Great food, excellent service and social distancing.  Safe parking for an SUV and Jetski!  We will be back on our next trip to visit our family!

name: Carson Miller
text: Rolled into town later at night, around 8 and stopped in for a quick bite. Food was so great and very large portions. Barbecue was smoked very nicely and tasted fantastic. Sides were also delicious, would definitely recommend the collard greens. Fun atmosphere with TVs all around. Great restaurant and amazing staff as well. Highly recommend for a good bite of barbecue.

name: Neil Young
text: The staff is extremely helpful and friendly.  The food was fresh and delicious and I had actually requested a  special item not on the menu and the staff was very helpful and made it happen. This was my first visit but definitely won't be the last. The atmosphere and environment was great.  Thank you all very much

resp.text: Thank you for the great review, Neil! We are glad you enjoyed your meal!

name: Blaine Evans
text:
Very long wait for an extremely simple order of a pound of turkey to go. Meat was cold when i finally received it. Seemed that drive-thru business was strongly favored for turnaround time over walk-in orders.

Food was good after reheating at home, however the menu could use clarification on the fact that turkey meat sold by the pound is not served pulled, like the pork, but sliced.

resp.text: Hi Blaine, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: David Trelles
text:
Prompt, great food! Very helpful staff!
Priced just right

name: Vicky Jones
text: Best pies, fast, courteous, fresh

name: Anita Olbon
text: Full Moon Bar-B-Que never disappoints.  The collards are excellent, and the loaded baked potato is enormous and delicious!  I get it with the chicken.  It's a barbeque spot, but the fried catfish is amazing too, and make sure you try the little cornbread muffin.  It has a hint of sweet, and baked just right.  Rob always gets an order of fried green tomatoes and Mac and cheese, and he loves their pulled pork.  We stop at the Walkers Chapel location quite often.

name: r lankford
text: My husband, daughter, and I stopped by last week to eat dinner. The kiddo got the hotdog and fries, she said it was pretty tasty (she loved that it came with a cookie and tattoo) My husband and I both got the bbq pork plate (Which comes with 2 sides and a toasted bun) There is enough meat for 2 sammiches on each plate so you can either pig out at one sitting or have enough for 2 meals. For the sides, I got fries and mac n cheese. The fries were your typical bland unsalted steak fries (still yummy dipped in bbq sauce) and the mac n cheese was eh. It felt like it’d sat for a while and the cheese started to coagulate (almost gritty) My husband got baked beans and fries and he said they were pretty good. The restaurant did a good job keeping people separated as best as they could.

name: KRYSTEN WOODS
text: the food was NOT the full moon I'm used to...I usually visit the the one on the South side or in greensprings...the Fultondale location DID NOT measure up to either location...the meat seemed old...we asked for center cut ribs...the meat was tough and seemed as though...whoever cooked the meat... rushed it...we also both asked for extra sauce on the side when we placed our order...when we asked the lady that brought our food for some...being that we didn't get it to begin with...she brought back one...the baker I got didn't wow me either...seemed as tho it wasn't freshly prepared...hardly no sour cream...or bacon bits..I wish I had taken pics...or taken it right back#dissapointed...to add insult to injury...the counter staff was not professional...before we left we ordered a large drink to go...the manager (heavy set Caucasian gentleman with dark brown hair) was told what to fix...he literally ignored the fact that i was waiting...but continued joking with the staff...I waited a few minutes thinking...maybe he didn't hear the young lady that called out what I ordered...he finally looked around the drink fountain...noticed that by now I was not pleased and asked me "what I needed....WILL NOT BE COMING BACK UNLESS UNDER NEW MANAGEMENT...AND STAFF IS REFRESHED ON CUSTOMER SERVICE

resp.text: Hello Krysten, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Scott Slauson
text: Really good BBQ, the chow chow relish on the brisket was phenomenal.

name: Violet Smith
text: They food is always hot and delicious.

name: Love Baby
text: My younger sister loves eating there every Thursday

name: John Boggan
text: The BBQ chicken sandwich I had was really good.

name: Dale Stanley
text: Great BBQ, if you are in Birmingham you've got to try Full Moon Bar-B-Que!!!

name: Valerie King
text: Dare I say the customer service at full moon is better than Chick-fil-A 😅😍 and those baked beans....🤤

name: Richard Ask
text: Had a variety of things for my first time there, good smoke, OK flavors, did not feel it lived up to the hype. A lot of folks we know love it, some say its alright. I found it in the midranges. Rated a 4 because staff was friendly, store was clean and food was edible.

name: William Burkett
text: Some of the best BBQ in Alabama! Great service

name: RapidriseTTV
text: Food was great but had a smaller portion of bbq than normal.

name: Patrick Araujo
text: At the first moment  you enter that place  team give you a comfortable feeling. Very courteous hosts, it is a lovely place to  enjoy with your friends or with your date. enjoyable  food, experienced  chief cook and stuff, comfortable  price and nice  service. Highly recommended.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review, Patrick! We are glad you enjoyed!

name: SHUN SMITH
text: Food was excellent and staff was friendly and they also give military discounts

name: MrJadeG
text: Good. My burger was pink in the middle though.

text: Awesome food and great service

name: Bill Reese
text: Fast line , fast service and great food.

name: Violet Smith
text: They food is always hot and delicious.

name: kim dalton
text: This was our first time to this restaurant.  We were heading into Chic fil a and wondered what Full Moon was. SO GOOD! Huge menu,  outstanding staff and the food was also great! Wish we had one in Ohio.

name: Palmer Richardson
text: Always great food

name: Jimmy Jacobs
text:
I went here with a group of friends. We numbered 10. This is a tough number of people at any places that has round tables and 4 tops. However, these folks don't Mind You doing a "mild" remodeling of the round tables if you are kind enough to put them back where you found them. (Remember, to put them back folks. I only suggest things that are common, but common decency dictates that we patrons not be obnoxious and rearrange everything and leave it with the help to fix.)
This is a bonus if your group number is a little odd.
I love the Baker w/pork. One of my favorites!!

name: Patrick Araujo
text: At the first moment  you enter that place  team give you a comfortable feeling. Very courteous hosts, it is a lovely place to  enjoy with your friends or with your date. enjoyable  food, experienced  chief cook and stuff, comfortable  price and nice  service. Highly recommended.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review, Patrick! We are glad you enjoyed!

name: Laura Graham
text: Delicious food. Quick and friendly service.

name: Warren Patrick
text: I tried this spot in the past with my friend and I am hooked since then. I enjoyed the fantastic atmosphere and flavorful food and beverages. I recommend this place.

name: MrJadeG
text: Good. My burger was pink in the middle though.

name: MARK HOLLOWAY
text: Southern fried catfish is great!! Ribs not bad either, squash casserole will hurt you!! 😁

text: Use order pickup for faster service.

name: Tonja Hooper
text: Great place for barbecue if you're not in the mood to cooking it yourself give it a try

name: Matthew Cook
text: Always a wonderful experience. A bit crowded on the weekend but overall worth it. Try the big Baker and the keylime pie. The cookies are great too.

name: Palmer Richardson
text: Always great food

name: CM Childs
text: We had a cheeseburger and a brisket meal. I enjoyed my brisket, greens and beans. The burger was good.

name: julie mclendon

name: Warren Patrick
text: I tried this spot in the past with my friend and I am hooked since then. I enjoyed the fantastic atmosphere and flavorful food and beverages. I recommend this place.

name: Edward House
text: From Ohio visiting family in Birmingham. We were craving BBQ and Full Moon has great reviews on Google. I thought the food was good but it did not have the "wow" factor. Service was fast but it has a casual fast food vibe to it.  This establishment is equivalent to the Boston Market of bbq.

name: Seretha Jolly
text: Always good food and great customer service. I love my drive thru cashier. She is very sweet and outgoing.

name: Bill Scaggs
text: Good BBQ

name: Amanda Lance
text: You pay $15 for a turkey plate. All the guy at the window for napkins and or there's a fork in the bag. The extra napkins you got are the only ones you got and of course no. For restaurant with such good food it's a shame to get a bad review over the small things. It's kind of hard to eat is $15 plate of food with no fork. Even after you asked.

resp.text: Hello Amanda, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Rodney Adams
text: Great food and staff. I always visit when in Birmingham! Brought the wife this trip and she enjoyed it as well!

name: Jennifer Stovall

name: Terri Lane Robertson
text: A favorite in our family. The pulled chicken salad with full moon Greek dressing is my favorite. The double potato and the barbecue are other favorites. You can't go wrong. Be sure to grab a cookie!

name: Tristan Hood
text: Outside sliced pork sandwich with chow chow, pickles, and plenty of barbecue sauce. That and the buffalo style Love Me Tenders are two reasons I enjoy Full Moon. Of course, the sportsy atmosphere helps as well. My family and I love to enjoy this place on family night.

name: Brenda Collins
text: The food was delicious!!! Absolutely love this place.

name: Samantha S
text: It was a cute and clean interior, fast and friendly service, and good food. The fried tomatoes and okra were really good. We liked that it was counter service - works better with a toddler in tow. It was a good value for what we got. We would return if in the area again.

name: Eugene “Breeze” Cooper
text: Great. Some of the best ribs I've had. Fries could be seasoned a little bit better

name: Charlotte Carlton
text: Great food, awesome conversation with the owner!!!

name: Mary Vaughn
text: The best bar-b-que! The food was amazing! The cookies and carrot cake are awesome! I will definitely go back!

name: Ryan Bourque
text: Fantastic and delicious food, I liked the character this spot has, and the staff members were kind. I will definitely eat here again.

name: Andy Quattrociocchi
text: Baby back ribs were dry and not flavorful sides were decent.

resp.text: Hi Andy, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

text: Great sandwich with ample meat and fast drive through service.

name: Philip Word

resp.text: Hello Philip, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Mary Richards
text: Waited 25 minutes in drive-thru for 1 pound of the driest and most over-priced chopped pork I’ve ever bought. On the positive side, when I complained about the wait, the cashier assured me in a sweet voice “we’re doing the best we can.”

resp.text: Hello Mary, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Misty Williams
text: The employees seemed to be more concerned with talking and hanging out with each other over making sure their customers were taken care of. I understand a happy and fun work experience but you always focus on customers first. I was disappointed in the experience all together.

resp.text: Hi Misty, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: jo wright
text: I asked for a pulled pork sandwich with slaw; there was no barbecue sauce on it at all. Not happy 😒

resp.text: Hello Jo, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Henry Greene
text: I am from the South but have lived in Indiana for years, so when I visit the South I always try to eat some good BBQ.  Since I don’t get truly GOOD BBQ here in the Midwest, I am very picky about where I eat it when I visit the South.  Full Moon is one of the BEST places to get it.  Excellent flavor, big portions, and good sides and desserts.  If you’ve never tried it, I highly recommend it.

name: Gary Harper
text: Sandwich and tea 9.00 but good.

name: Stacy Brunner
text: Great food.  Great service.

name: Catherlene Davis
text: Asked for extra sauce. Only got enough sauce for top slice of bread

name: Rodney Pickle
text: Great grilled chicken. I love it without the sauce with vegetables.  Lower calories.

name: Paula Kessler
text: I have to admit, I really didn't expect much.  I thought it might would be on the fast food side.  Although, it did come out fast, it was a delight to know it didn't taste like fast food.  The vinegar slaw is amazing.   I had the BBQ chicken sandwich and it was delicious.   I will be eating here again!

name: Kieran M
text: The food was amazing! My little brother had a pork sandwich. We went through the drive through this time and the service was still amazing! We will definitely be coming back.

name: Leslie Calvert
text: Fried green tomatoes are amazing..their meat is wonderful but so are their sides and famous half dipped cookies and pie..great chow chow and food

name: Kimberly Allen
text: My meal was wonderful and so was my son's! The pull pork plate and pulled pork sandwich was awesome!!

name: Anna Taylor
text: Love there food the Ribs fall off the bone and there Loaded potatoes is a lot

name: Chantelle Rogers
text: Hubby always gets the open faced pork sandwich and it fills him up....like he can't finish his fries fills him up lol. Kids love the tenders and Mac n cheese. I'm a simple pulled chicken girl, but occasionally splurge and get their AMAZING brisket or ribs. Their vegetable of the day happened to be steamed cabbage and it was amazing! I have had their carrot cake and it's super good too. Honestly I don't think I've ever had anything here that wasn't delicious!

name: Thea Farley
text: I can definitely recommend the smoked wings. You can get them in several flavors. The white sauce is so good that it will make you bite your tongue you will eat so fast. The pies are so good. I suggest that you eat rest a while then eat the pie. I can't say enough about those wings especially if you want wings but not the grease that comes with fried wings.

name: Stephen Mcalister
text: As always amazing food. Dine in is now available

name: Christopher Batten
text: Covid-visited this place, and wished I was a local. Catfish was surprisingly good, BBQ was stellar.

resp.text: Hello Christopher, thank you for your feedback. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your experience at our Fultondale location! We hope to have you back soon!

name: Henry Akins bike
text: Fast and good service

name: Rosa Robinson
text: We love this place. We stop any time we are driving through. Today I had the turkey breast, collard greens, Mac and cheese. It was all very good.

name: Kelly Rickert
text: Very good barbeque.  We stopped on a Thursday eve just going through to Florida. Pulled pork plate was excellent. Cole slaw very good. Not sweet. Unsweet tea- We northerners love them for that! Hubby had brisket & pork. His  very tasty as well. One item the mac & cheese is very bland. But over all would absolutely recommend.

text: Love there food the Ribs fall off the bone and there Loaded potatoes is a lot

name: Chris Fellows
text: We come here every time we have a meeting in Birmingham. Boss pays so I don't complain. Food here is good and the service is quick. Prices are decent for barbecue. Parking lot is a bit cramped though. We ended up parking next door and hiking down an embankment.

name: Michele Fedak
text: Staff is super friendly & helpful. This was my 1st time, from out of town,  truck is in repair shop & mechanic recommended. They recommended different things to me. DidF is awesome. I thought it was a little pricey but well worth it. Good size portions, actually couldn't even finish it all. Will definitely come back again when in area

resp.text: Hi, Michele! Thank you for the kind words! We are so pleased to hear you chose our restaurant as your place to dine and that you enjoyed it! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Kip Blighton
text:
Smoked pork that tastes like smoked pork
No funny business here, just smoked pork.  Oh, the tea is good.

name: Susan Pollitz
text: If you want the best meal in town go to the FULL MOON IN FULTONDALE AL. There always fast friendly and the food is awesome !!! Best bbq ever !!!

name: Ledree Martin
text: When I went through the drive thru the employees were playing around so much they gave me food without requesting payment. I corrected that! I purchased a bbq chicken sandwich yesterday for my lunch today and it had so many bones I got scared and lost my appetite. I do not and  will not recommend this particular restaurant until new management or serious changes are made. You all need to take food and safety more serious!

resp.text: Hi Ledree, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Tom Mclemore
text: Very fast ser vice, BBQ nachos we're great, easily enough for two to share. The deviled eggs were out of this world. You have to get a 1/2 dozen of the 1/2 moon cookies, be careful when opening the package, you may eat all them at one time.

name: don miller
text: Awesome food,very affordable. They have a little something for everyone. From fish to chicken to pork. The wait isn't long,the atmosphere is cozy.

name: Denise Smith
text: Great food

name: Jeff Marsh
text: Clean fast nice people and very helpful.

name: Kurt Wade
text: One of my favorite places to eat. Kickin Pamento Burger is Amazing!

name: Larry Brown
text: Great Food!

name: tony gray
text: Always good food

name: Chris Fellows
text: We come here every time we have a meeting in Birmingham. Boss pays so I don't complain. Food here is good and the service is quick. Prices are decent for barbecue. Parking lot is a bit cramped though. We ended up parking next door and hiking down an embankment.

name: Kayla Hogan
text: WHAT'S NOT TO LOVE ABOUT THIS BBQ! BEST LOADED POTATO I HAVE EVER EATEN +PORK & CHOW CHOW *THIS CHOW CHOW IS TO DIE FOR IN MY OPINION*!!

name: Betty Williams
text: We pick up to-go at the drive-through. Best BBQ! My fave is the smoked chicken. My husband likes the brisket. We live in Blount County so sandwiches get soggy. No problem. If you ask, they will separate the ingredients for you! Love this place!

name: M Seng
text:
Stopped for lunch on the way south a few weeks ago. I had spent some time researching BBQ joints on my route and Full Moon kept popping up as the place to go. They did not disappoint.

Even though we arrived during the lunch hour, the wait in line was minimal. Wife and I split a couple sandwiches, the smoked turkey and beef brisket, both were simply fantastic. We split an order of onion rings that must have been an entire onion. OMG, they were GREAT!

Don't know when I may be in the area again, but Full Moon Bar-B-Que will definitely be on the radar for another visit.

name: Juanita Farr
text: Tasty food. Ample portions. Limited beer choices at this location. Big selection of BBQ....chicken, pork, & ribs. Good sides that go well with BBQ.

name: jmoakley1
text: If you find a better chain that serves bbq let me know. Great food, atmosphere and customer service!

name: Steve Bennett
text: I always enjoy their ribs

name: tommy reeves
text: Awesome as usual

name: Jarrod Davis
text: Ever in the Birmingham area please go by the place the menu is awesome and don't leave without getting the chocolate chip cookies

name: GEORGE AMBRIZ
text: Food is good , I expect something better for the price ,but employees make it up , there nice and courtesy .

name: Lender Harris
text: Good food

name: Susan Wozniak
text: Good home style cooking, sqeaky clean, attentive staff, and fast service.  Great stop off from I65!

name: Darnesheia Alexander
text: Fast and efficient take out service. Delicious brisket sandwich!

name: Erin Howze
text: Food was prepared quickly and there wasn't a long wait.

name: Doris Brown
text: Great.

name: Jesse Larue
text: The food was good and very quick service

name: bjt 2077
text: This is by far the best barbecue I've ever had and the restaurant is always very clean and has a nice atmosphere.

name: April King
text: The food was great however employee attitude wasn't. We did not hear our number called and the young lady who brought our food attitude was a mess. I will continue to visit however next time I guess I'll eat in to avoid this next time

name: Stephan Hanson
text: We tried this place while visiting friends in Birmingham, Alabama. Not sure if this is a chain or how many states they are in but the food was very good. As a Texan I am very fond of beef-centric bbq, but I do love me some pork ribs. I enjoyed everything about this place.

name: Carrie Foster
text: Fast and fantastic!!!

name: Allie Field
text: One of my favorite places to eat.  Food is plenty here, low priced for food amount, friendly customer service, and I respect their values. I had the pulled Greek salad and he had a loaded potato.  It was loaded alright.  We had to take most of it home because how much was on it.

name: Deric Cain
text: The Chick-fil-A of BBQ! This is a great family BBQ place. The smoked turkey is the best around.

name: Kia Chatman
text: I have had better, but; they are convenient, so it has to do.

name: Williamina Feagin
text: The food was fresh. Great taste. It doesn't take long to get your order

name: Ella lalonde'
text: I absolutely garantee a positively visit when you're here great atmosphere ,nice friendly people, food is served at an so so rate only because they are always busy! Worth the stop my tummy is thanking me for !!\(ϋ)/♩

name: Scott Holmes
text: Always good.  The beef brisket was exceptional today.

name: Nakiii
text: Very clean with great service. I got a veggie plate. Their fried green tomatoes were amazing. I drove back to order more! Will visit again. (Online pricing may not be accurate. It wasn't for sides)

resp.text: Thanks for the love, Golden Pro! Our Fried Green Tomatoes are the BEST!

name: Katie Veglio
text: BBQ was pretty good. Some of the sides tasted like buffet food but service was quick and the atmosphere was great!

name: Reynel Valladares
text: Ok

name: Margaret Batie
text: The food was excellent. I ordered the smoked chicken with Alabama white sauce and sweet potato casserole. Yummy!!!

name: Joseph Bliss
text: Even though it was crowded the service was fast and the food was just as good as always.

name: pangris
text: Went out of our way to try this place based on the reviews and we were not disappointed

name: Judy Jeter
text: The best

name: GiGi Travel Blogs
text: My Favorite Barbecue Spot.

name: Susan Pierce
text: Amazing but busy

name: Keith Walker
text: Great food and good service can't beat it

name: Nathan Watts
text: This is one of my favorite places to eat when traveling down Interstate 65. I have never had a bad experience here. The food is always great! I suggest you try their baked potatoes, they are huge!   Service is always quick and friendly. The facility is always clean and welcoming! If you ever pass by a Full Moon Bar-B-Q be sure to stop in, you will be glad you did!

resp.text: Hey Nathan! You sure know how to make us blush! Thanks for the kind review, we work hard to make sure you have a great experience at Full Moon BBQ! Come back and see us soon.

name: Christine Romano
text: Great food! Fast and very polite service. I've dined in and gotten to-go food. I've have yet to have a poor experience. The management there is doing a great job!

resp.text: Hi Christine, we are so glad you have had great experiences at our Fultondale location! We look forward to your next visit!

name: Bigbudman63 Mejia
text: Ribs, chow chow, catfish, okra and mac and cheese was really good.  Got full so couldn't have dessert.  Taking a whole chicken home for lunch tomorrow.

name: Dewayne Shoulders
text: It was my first time eating there. I really enjoyed. The food was great.

name: Banshi Kat
text: I rarely get a bad plate at full moon.  Had the catfish this visit,  which was a well seasoned, thick filet. Not that thin flimsy filet that's more breading than food.

name: Llewellyn Robinson
text: Good food, very friendly staff... Definitely will be returning

name: LaToya Holmes
text: The food & customer service is always good.

name: Dana Smith
text: The brisket salad was amazing!

name: Terry Greenslade
text: Great place to eat.

name: Travis McBride
text: The food came out fast and the people were really friendly. The place was clean, just a little crowded, but to be expected with the time of day we went. The food was good, as you would expect from a fast food BBQ place.

resp.text: Hi Travis, thank you for the feedback! We're glad you had a good experience!

name: Annamarie Wallace
text: Their food is always hot and delicious! Today they were so nice when I ordered the wrong thing, they didn't even hesitate to correct the order!! They were so polite and fast to make our experience as positive as possible!! They are my BBQ destination no matter my location!!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Annamarie! See you again soon!

name: Rhonda Smith
text: Great as usuall & BBQ potatoes was huge as usual. Loved it!!!

name: Brian Hood
text: The next BBQ salad & big Baker

name: Amel Drake
text: Very good BBQ, don't let it being a chain fool you. This stuff is legendary

name: Carlee Smallwood
text: Wouldn't recommend going while busy.. Just left there and paid almost 11$ for a loaded potato that came with less than a teaspoon of sour cream, no butter and a sprinkle of meat and cheese..if it wasn't take out I would have asked for my refund

resp.text: Hi Carlee, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: J Irby
text: Awesome food!

name: William Jennings
text: I got the 2 meat plate. Chicken and Ribs always a great choice. You can choose any two meats, there's a small up charge for Brisket..But it is most definitely worth it. The plate comes with two sides... your regular fair from a quality BBQ restaurant. But I do recommend the beans, and Mac&Cheese.. Full-Moon BBQ is my favorite no matter where I try I always come back to the Moon... You will to

resp.text: Hi William, thank you for the awesome feeback. Come see us soon!

name: Terry Price Ware
text: Wow! So much better than in town locations.  Service superior!  Good tasty!

name: Lewis Petty
text: Good food, big portions. At a decent price. The place is always packed

name: Chris Evans
text: Fantastic BBQ chain. Our large group we're very pleased with the food and service

name: Mark McKinney
text: The BBQ was good but the sides consisting of corn on the cob and steak fries were cold. My wife and daughters baked potatoes were under lukewarm. They replaced my wife's cold potato with a cold BBQ sandwich. This is NOT how their food is usually served. I am going to understand it's New year's Eve but they close at 8CST.  Plenty of time to get ready and get out for New year's Eve events.

name: Valerie Lumpkin
text: Awesome Food

name: Ryan Stubbs
text: Consistently great food and service. Love their smoked turkey for a healthier meat option.  Their pulled pork sandwich is delicious and love their greens.

name: Qdubus Maximus
text: There BBQ Baked Potato is the best you can find anywhere and so big you can share. There chicken fingers are some of the best I've had anywhere. Most places tend to over marinate there chicken. These were just right. Prices are a bit higher than typical BBQ joints but the serving sizes and taste are well worth it

name: Diana White
text: Always an awesome experience at the foultondale location! The workers are so pleasant and courteous! Also the service is always fast. The food is excellent!

name: Jeremy Sopher
text: Staff was amazing and food was awesome! Special thanks to manager for sweet tater casserole, my wife LOVED it! That was above and beyond!

name: Bill Allen
text: Great service, great food. Love to eat here.

name: Amel Drake
text: Very good BBQ, don't let it being a chain fool you. This stuff is legendary

name: Valerie Lumpkin
text: Awesome Food

text: This is a an ALL 5 STAR REVIEW...   This is Truly The BEST BBQ Place I’ve been to... Had the Chicken n Rib Plate with trimmings.  I recommend this Place and don’t forget to come on an Empty Stomach...This is Napster and I APPROVE OF THIS MESSAGE... Keep On Truckin’!!!

resp.text: Hi Napolean, we're so glad to hear that! Be sure to try our bakers, burgers, and award-winning desserts next time you come!

name: patricia fuller
text: Very clean, super nice people, Very good food! Would definitely eat there again.

name: Tera
text: We got the pulled pork with okra and corn and ribs with mac and cheese and potato salad. Meat was dry. Corn was over cooked and even the cornbread was dry. Mac n cheese and okra was good. And their sauce is actually good.

resp.text: Hi, Tera. While we're happy to hear you enjoyed some of your meal, complete customer satisfaction is our #1 priority. Can you please provide your contact information to fullmoonsocialmedia@gmail.com? Our manager would like to speak with you directly.

name: Brian Hood
text: The next BBQ salad & big Baker

name: Ashley Murphy
text: This place never disappoints!! The food is always hot and cooked to perfection! My family of 7 love going here after church or at night. My daughter and I always share the riblets and a Greek salad and we leave stuffed! Of course with a dozen cookies for when we get home!

name: Kelvin Kimble
text: Good service and food.

name: MrSupr3me
text: the best bbq place in the south! extreme fast service and great food! always crowded but its ok!

name: Jeremy Sopher
text: Staff was amazing and food was awesome! Special thanks to manager for sweet tater casserole, my wife LOVED it! That was above and beyond!

name: Joey
text: The food is always fresh and delicious. The staff is always friendly.

name: Bill C
text: Stopped for lunch today.  Had pork sandwich, a side of greens, sweet tea, and a piece of carrot cake. Everything was great except the cake.  But $17.12 for lunch is ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS!!! That should have fed 2 people for that price. Not just 1 person. Won't return.

name: Ashley Murphy
text: This place never disappoints!! The food is always hot and cooked to perfection! My family of 7 love going here after church or at night. My daughter and I always share the riblets and a Greek salad and we leave stuffed! Of course with a dozen cookies for when we get home!

text: Great food, but this location has a habit of getting my order wrong or forgetting to include all of the items. Update: unlike most places at least someone responded to my post. Thumbs up for that at least they care. You get one more star for that.👍

resp.text: Hi Anthony, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing director at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience.

When the young man Rodrick saw me having trouble getting up from the chair he offered (and did) carry my food to the car for me.  Also, the person who waited on me at the he register was extremely nice and professional.  Thanks to everyone, including those working behind the scenes this evening.  I will be going back in the future.

resp.text: We are so happy with your experience, Sharon! All of our employees work so hard, and it is great to hear feedback from our happy customers!

text: I always get the regular bbq sandwich with plain Lay's. Delicious every time I go!

name: Bobby Franklin
text: Food is always awesome! And service was pretty good; in and out in a minute.

name: Sabrina Cunningham
text: I was visiting my family in Alabama and decided to purchase some food from Full Moon Bar-b-Que . The food there was horrible. The chicken wings was spoiled and the ribs tasted like lighter fluid. The mac and cheese was soupy also the greens had no flavor. this was the worse food ever.

name: Keith J
text: They put a gigantic amount of pulled pork on my sandwich which I appreciated. But it was hard to keep meat from falling out while eating and driving. There wasn't much sauce, onion and slaw-relish or whatever else it is that they put on it though. What they did put on there was slapped on one side of the sandwich and half of that ended up in the wrap. Altogether it was a dry and sloppy sandwich.

name: XxdragonlordxX l
text: Good barbecue and nachos!!!

name: Sheila Merchant
text: Loved the food. The wait was long but they gave me some cookies to ease the pain. It was well worth it 😊

name: Deanmu6uio Paulin
text:
Great food! Best to come a little early or late.
Usually a big crowd. Very well run and good prices. Loaded menu!

resp.text: Thanks for the love! We hope to see you again soon!

name: John Seed
text: I’ve been here so many times that they basically know my whole family. I’ve tried everything, from the catfish, to wings, to BBQ, to a Caesar Salad, and I can tell you, it’s all worth ordering again, and again, and again, and so on. The service is very quick, and the people are very kind to boot. If you haven’t tried this, you’ve wasted your life.

name: Zavier De'Sine
text: Not a fan of the sauce but the food is really good. I am pretty sure the Jolly Green Giant grows their Big Baker 🥔. It's about the size of a 10 year olds head. Plus their ribs are fall off the bone good, and then they make their own sausages that are insanely good.

name: Joel Rhaly
text: Food was very good. Get there early because it seems everyone may share my opinion because the dining area was packed. Standing room only.

name: Martin Jackson
text: Ribs fell off the bone, the bake beans so good I went back for more. OMG the pie is to die for.

name: Rebecca Moss
text: The baker, a HUGE baked potato is fantastic when you put the Angus beef on top of it.  It made 3 meals for me. Also,  I love their ice!

name: Napoleon Posadas
text: This is a an ALL 5 STAR REVIEW...   This is Truly The BEST BBQ Place I’ve been to... Had the Chicken n Rib Plate with trimmings.  I recommend this Place and don’t forget to come on an Empty Stomach...This is Napster and I APPROVE OF THIS MESSAGE... Keep On Truckin’!!!

resp.text: Hi Napolean, we're so glad to hear that! Be sure to try our bakers, burgers, and award-winning desserts next time you come!

name: Kmberlee Mercer
text: The center cut ribs are delicious, I love there slaw, bake bean ,and the squash casserole is good, the cat fish one of my favorite

name: Jon Booke
text:
Consistently good food and friendly atmosphere, but always feel rushed going through the order line which can be unpleasant. Also often out of warm barbecue sauce bottles during lunchtime and have seen the same happen at dinner time. Why don’t you either keep them replenished or have more bottles put out at the beginning? Also, why is the wall menu so hidden on the back wall? — we really can’t see the menu well until we get to the counter then we feel rushed. Keep up the good work overall, but you have room for improvement.

UPDATE:
I am updating my review because this location now has more warm barbecue sauce available because it looks like that put in another pot for them.

It’s probably too much to think that the wall menu will be fixed, probably too much expense.

name: kelly watts
text: Have usually enjoyed Blue Moon,  have been excited they are coming to Hville. Was in the Gardendale location today while in town briefly and was disappointed.  Was staffed almost entirely by very young folk. Food was served cold to myself And other customers nearby, wrong sides served to wrong customers and we were told quite impatiently to figure it out and trade around. The sweet tea ran out, by that point I wasn't surprised the kids running the joint didn't offer to get us some from the kitchen. And I think they used the food processor to chop the meat, it was minced to the point of no texture.

name: Marci Shemaria
text: We just love this bbq, we stop whenever we are nearby

name: Jeanna Fredericksen
text: Group of 14 hungry travelers were all pleased. Delicious food, huge portions,  friendly and fast service. Dedicated fryers fir the fries so gluten free is an option. Thanks for a great experience

name: Donna Evans
text: Last week "carried out" pork salads- meat soggy. So, this week "carried out" pork plate, sandwich and onion rings. Took a couple bites, looking for sauce cups, there was not even ONE! Had to wrap and save for later 'till we can go get sauce. I even requested sauce, check 93, 28 Dec.

name: Ann McAnnally
text: I love Full Moon. The only complaint is the drive thru took forever.  Very courteous employees.

name: Kelvin Harris
text: I enjoy the service. They were all excellence people and very professional. I will come again.

name: tiffany benefield
text: The best BBQ in the state of Alabama hands down.

resp.text: Hi Tiffany! Thank you for your feedback. We look forward to serving you again soon!

name: Preston Edmonds
text: This place has great BBQ.

name: Ed Faser
text: Good food, dining room open.

name: Marta Reaves
text: Quick service

name: robin belk
text: Very delicious hamburgers and onion rings!

name: Drew C.
text: Nothing much to complain about. Good pulled pork.  Good ribs.  Fried green tomatoes were well seasoned but a little soggy. Drumsticks were a little dry.

resp.text: Hi Andrew, thanks for the feedback. We're glad you had a good experience and hope to see you again soon!

name: Joe Conn
text: Great bbq

name: Cool Beans
text: I experienced racism at the drive thru today. The two cashiers, 1 african american and 1 caucasian, saw that i was Hispanic and they joked "No Speak English." When the african American saw that I heard it he tried to change the topic and said "I only speak black." To add insult to injury....i ordered a HALF CHICKEN, i specifically asked for the thigh and leg. Well.... upon arriving home I open it and there were 3 wings, two rib parts with some breast, a spine, and some disgusting looking gut thing! WHAT KIND OF CHICKEN HAS 3 WINGS?! Also my chow chow was leaked, and my pickles too...i had pickle juice everywhere! The store is closed right now, but im returning it first thing in the morning! And if the manager doesn't do right by me and my family (because they didn't eat dinner), i will cal corporate offices and filing a complaint with the BBB. Just because I look different doesn't mean i don't deserve 1st Class service. And I'm taking this very seriously because i want other Hispanics to be treated equally.

resp.text: Hi Melissa, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: terry brown
text: Really good food and lots of sports on TV'S.

name: Vickie Victoriana
text: Best bar-b-que in Birmingham!

name: Kenneth mccoy
text: Love the baby back ribs

name: Hector Alvarado
text: Nice place clean anywhere  I recommend

text: A must stop for my family Every time we are in town. Great food and great sweet tea.

name: Hammer Man
text: Good food, but honestly a little pricier than it should be. But those cookies....yum!

name: Kenneth Hailey
text: To me Full Moon is one of the best barbecue chains in Birmingham, AL. Their chicken and rib plate with baked beans and collard greens is absolutely delicious and very filling! Definitely one of my most favorite barbecue restaurants!

resp.text: Hi Kenneth, thanks for the awesome review!

name: Elaine Lee
text: Friendly fast service.

name: george olsofsky
text: Fantastic BBQ. Great staff and waiters. Friendly family orienated place to eat. Give it an A+. You will not be disappointed and will not go away hungry.  Their loaded BBQ potato  is the best and biggest in the Bham area. Enjoy....

resp.text: Your review is the BEST, George! Thank you for such kind words! We're happy you enjoyed your visit! See you again soon!

name: Virginia Gaines
text: The food was Awesome and enjoy it gave me a lot for the money.

name: Albert Butler
text: Always great food and fast service

name: Mary Angrisano Ladner
text: I have been eating at Full Moon for over 20years now, back when they only had one location on 6th Avenue  South.  I worked right next door at BRESCO, the guys there have always been very  polite and  had great food combined with great customer service.  I  am  so happy to see their success in franchising.  This is the only place I go when I want bbq. Delicious, great quality and selection for a reasonable price, always clean and staff is courteous! Great job guys..congratulations:)

name: eddie roan
text: Always great food and experience. Greek Salad with Pulled Chicken always superb, coconut pie is the greatest. Love the ribs and Bbq also. Service is always fantastic

resp.text: Hi Eddie! Thanks for the great review, we couldn't agree more! Come back and see us soon!

name: Mrs. Ouida Johnson Beauty, Planning & Cooking
text: Did not like. The meat was so finely chopped you could not taste that it was bar b q pork. The ribs looked good but after trying the loaded potato didn't want to take a chance. Won't recommend.  Glad we have a Rick's and other options

resp.text: Ouida, we sincerely apologize about your poor experience. Can you please provide your contact information to fullmoonsocialmedia@gmail.com? Our manager would like to speak with you directly.

name: Virgina Silor
text: I love their Greek salad w/pulled BBQ chicken. Very generous portions & no matter how long the line for the drive-thru is, it moves quickly. The staff hustles! Their slaw is delicious & they have a good veggie selection. Hubby loves their brisket & loaded baked potatoes w/BBQ pork. Don't forget the chocolate cream pie!

name: Kirk Roberts
text: The turkey didn’t have a ton of underlying flavor to the actual meat. The sauce was good, though, and so were the fries. Decent beer selection, and the sweet tea was spot on.  Very friendly staff, and store was clean.

name: Laura Furnas Cannady
text: Their barbecue potato covered my entire plate!  This was a very satisfying lunch stop.  The barbecue sauce leaves a memorable impression and craving for more.

resp.text: Hi Laura, we're glad you had a great experience. Be sure to try our burgers, bakers, and award-winning desserts!

text: I love this place. We try to go at least twice a month. We love it all. Favorite meal is chicken fingers, fries,green tomatoes.  But love the loaded potatoes just as much.

Amazing!!! Service! They are super nice walking around asking if u need anything and how you meal is. The food I wonderful! But I really loved the costumer service!
This is also a poke-stop for you pokemon go players

Picked up a pound of Bar B Que
The pork is always good. They also have pulled chicken which I love on a salad. The carrot cake and fried okra are also good. Friendly people, good service.

name: Jan Thomas
text: A semi- fast food, order at the counter, take a number and food will be brought to you when ready. It was my first time and it was busy and confusing as the counter personnel ASSUME you know their process. I almost missed the delicious squash casserole and steamed cabbage as they were not on the menu but on a small sign on the back of the register.... It was pricey for not having better service. The food was very good but the experience bordered on unpleasant

Had the best veggie
Nfish boiled fresh okra collards tomatoes cornbread. After eye surgery Feb 6. Unsweet tea really good food

name: Only One

name: Chris
text:
Sunday lunch rush wow!  Geez this place was super busy and yet we still had excellent service and good BBQ.

Full moon always has consistent BBQ. Though it's not hand pulled, like mine, but it is still good.  No trip is complete without the half Moon cookies for my kids and I guess me.

If large crowds bother you and your not patient Sunday at lunch time is not for you.

name: Daren Falcon
text: Good food here!

name: Britt S.
text: The food comes out quickly and is always good. I love Full Moon BBQ. Their BBQ chicken baked potato is always a great choice!

resp.text: Hi Britt, we're glad to hear you had a great experience! Be sure to try our burgers and ribs at your next visit!

name: Jan Dotson-Nash
text: Good pulled pork.  I like my bq sauce on the side.

name: John Leonardi
text:
Every time I come to Birmingham this is one of the places that I like to stop at.  The only two complaint I have is how the drink fountain is not on the dinning room floor area, the menu board is hard to see while waiting in line due to the drink fountain and the top header, (just ask for a paper menu when you get in there to see everything they have to offer) but these are just minor inconvenience.
I love their pies and cakes and their BBQ salad ( its a big Salad) and their BBQ tater (a meal by itself).
Enjoy!

name: Matt Schutz
text: Good food, about 100 employees working, none were of much help.
